description:
Program Overview:

Our Summer Intern program offers hardworking college students an opportunity to go beyond the classroom to develop leadership skills and gain relevant hands on experience working as part of a global support team with professionals across the enterprise. Additionally, interns will participate in scheduled activities throughout the summer, including sessions with Senior Leaders, site tours, volunteer opportunities, and other social events. Fiserv interns are in session from June 2, 2021 – August 13, 2021 and work approximately 40 hours per week.

Do you want to work on leveraging the latest cloud technologies in solving business problems? Do you want to work with colleagues who are establishing the next generation application platform for Fiserv? You will gain an insight into real world systems, the challenges associated with such systems and best practices in solving the challenges.

Card Services from Fiserv enables financial institutions of any size to maximize their payments business, improve acquisition and retention, reduce expenses, minimize risk and grow share of wallet. We provide services for payments, processing services, Risk and Compliance, and gaining insights into spending habits

Candidate Qualifications & Education Requirements

What we are looking for…

  • Currently pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Analytics and more
  • GPA 3.0+ preferred
  • Knowledge of cloud architecture like Azure, AWS etc.
  • Knowledge of a programming language like Java, Python, Go, C, C+ etc.
  • Ability to diagnose and fix issues Passion for technology and automation
  • Military-Affiliated candidates encouraged to apply (Veterans, Military Spouses, and Guard/Reservists)
  • Must possess unrestricted work authorization and not require future sponsorship

Majors:

A wide range of bachelor’s degree programs considered, based upon specific department needs, such as: Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Data Analytics, Finance, Economics, Accounting, Business Administration, Mathematics, Supply Chain, Human Resources, Purchasing, Sales and Communications

Learn more about Fiserv:

To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that provides flexibility and affordability with a variety of medical, dental, vision, life insurance and disability options.

We are #FISVProud of our benefits and well-being programs. Our commitment to wellness, wellness education, preventive services and fitness activities are designed to meet you where you are.

Life moves fast. And as it does, we know most people aren’t thinking about “financial services”. But we are.

We help people and businesses move money and information every minute of every day. Our solutions connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another, millions of times a day, behind the scenes, reliably and securely.

We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments enabling innovative financial services experiences that are in step with the way people live and work today. The company’s approximately 44,000 associates proudly serve clients in more than 100 countries, so their customers, members and consumers can move money when and where they need it, at the point of thought.

Our Aspiration is to move money and information in a way that moves the world. As a FORTUNE™ 500 company and one of FORTUNE Magazine World’s Most Admired Companies for the seventh consecutive year, we are committed to excellence and purposeful innovation.

We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran

Explore the possibilities of a career with Fiserv and Find Your Forward with us.

#FSINT

EnerSys is the global leader in stored energy solutions for industrial applications. We have over thirty manufacturing and assembly plants worldwide servicing over 10,000 customers in more than 100 countries. Worldwide headquarters are located in Reading, PA, USA with regional headquarters in Europe and Asia. We complement our extensive line of Motive Power and Energy Systems with a full range of integrated services and systems. With sales and service locations throughout the world, and over 100 years of battery experience, EnerSys is the power/full solution for stored DC power products. We continue to grow in our industry by ensuring all employees possess the following core competencies: customer focused, team player, engaged, ethical, strong communication skills, and works safely.


Job Purpose

Provides embedded engineering support to systems engineering department to gain exposure and experience in desired field of study.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

  • Develop and debug code for ARM micocontrollers
  • Develop applications for embedded Linux systems
  • Develop IoT based technologies for wired and wireless protocols (802.11 and 802.15.4)
  • Soldering and hands-on hardware debugging using tools such as oscilloscopes, multi-meters, DC power supplies, etc.
  • Devising controller peripherals and architecture layouts


Qualifications

Basic Qualifications

  • Candidate should be a graduate student or enrolled in undergraduate program related to computer science, electrical engineering, etc.
  • The candidate should have an outstanding academic record, excellent organizational, interpersonal communication and written skills, strong quantitative and computer skills.

General Job Requirements

  • This position will work in an office setting, expect minimal physical demands.

EnerSys provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. EEO/M/F/Vets/Disabled

EEO is the Law

EEO is the Law Supplement

Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination

About our group:

The Consumer Solutions Group’s Product Line Manager Team carefully reviews market trends and user interaction for storage devices and value-added software. The team includes Product Managers, UX Designers, Documentation Writers/Editors and a Data Scientist. The telemetry we receive from our software is critical to all members of the team since it is highly leveraged for decision-making with current and future products.

About the role - you will:

The Data Analyst Intern will help maintain and build out the analytics capabilities for the Consumer Solutions Group. The position will collaborate with internal teams to ensure the accuracy and integrity of the data in Amazon Web Services Redshift, Oracle and other databases. The position will also help produce reports and analyses using Looker, our business intelligence and data analytics platform. The ideal candidate will have the basic understanding of gathering data, clean up, aggregation, analysis and insights. They should have experience with data storage, cleanup and manipulation technologies like SQL or Excel. Responsibilities could include one or more of the following:

  • Work with internal teams to modify existing or create new telemetry for our software products
  • Verify and validate the data collected from our software products using SQL
  • Create data visualizations or modify existing reports using Looker
  • Help maintain our existing data infrastructure and assist in performance improvement initiatives
  • Assist in improving our data collection infrastructure using Boomi – our iPaas Platform (Integration Platform as a Service)
  • Analyze Drive Health with Machine Learning to allow Predictive Analysis to anticipate Drive Failure

Interns typically work Monday thru Friday 8am to 5pm. The hours are subject to change with or without notice at the sole discretion of Seagate.

About you:

  • Current student pursuing a BS degree in Computer Science or Data Science and returning to school in Fall 2021
  • Analytical and data driven mindset
  • Attention to detail and documented, repeatable processes
  • Knowledgeable in data storage, data cleanup and data manipulation techniques
  • Direct experience with SQL
  • Proficiency in some programming language (C, C++, Python)
  • Familiarity with Machine Learning / AI and Predictive Analysis
  • Experience with Looker, Alteryx or KNIME are a plus

Location:

In response to COVID-19, this position may temporarily begin and be performed remotely. Seagate is actively evaluating the virus and our employees' health and safety are our top priority. In the future, this position will report to and be performed at our Fremont, CA


Location: Fremont, CA


Our Gold LEED-certified Fremont product-design campus drives innovation, bringing together a diverse set of engineering, design, operations, support and administrative teams. The site is equipped with state-of-the-art clean room and lab space. On-site social activities are popular, including our annual BBQ, ice cream social, and holiday events. Wellness programs, gaming rooms and the on-site fitness center help round out and balance your Seagate work-life experience, along with opportunities to give back to our local community.


#internship

Are you a rising senior, grad student or recent grad looking to further your knowledge of software development and gain valuable work experience? Qlarant is offering an eight-week summer internship for a high achieving candidate with a grade point average of at least 3.0.

The internship is based in our Easton, Maryland headquarters. The selected candidate should plan to work 40 hours per week with a start date of June 7, 2021. The start date is preferred but there is flexibility if a different date is needed.

The Software Development Intern will work with Qlarant’s Development team to maintain existing applications and develop new applications based on user requirements. Under the direction of your assigned mentor, the internship may include but is not limited to the following:

  • Consults with clients to gather information about program needs, objectives, functions, features, and input and output requirements.
  • Analyzes, defines, and documents requirements for data, workflow, logical processes, hardware and operating system environment, interfaces with other systems, internal and external checks and controls, and outputs.
  • Writes and maintains technical specifications.
  • Analyzes and estimates feasibility, costs, time, and compatibility with hardware and other programs.
  • Develops and maintains plans outlining steps and timetables for developing programs.
  • Researches and evaluates software and hardware to assist in programming or to use as program platforms.
  • Designs and codes screen layouts, graphical user interfaces, printed outputs, and interfaces with other systems.
  • Converts designs and specifications into computer code.
  • Compiles code into programs and corrects errors detected in compile process.
  • Creates test transactions and runs tests to find errors and confirm programs meet specifications.
  • Analyzes code to find causes of errors and revises programs.
  • Consults with client to prototype, refine, test, and debug programs to meet needs.
  • Writes and maintains documentation to describe program development, logic, coding, testing, changes, and corrections.
  • Writes documentation or reviews documentation written by others that describes installation and operating procedures.
  • Provides technical assistance by responding to inquiries from others regarding errors, problems, or questions about programs.
  • Trains end users or technical support staff to use programs.
  • Installs and tests programs at client site.
  • Monitors performance of programs after implementation.
  • Completion and presentation of a final project.


Required Skills


To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:

  • Analytical - Synthesizes complex or diverse information; Collects and researches data; Uses intuition and experience to complement data; Designs work flows and procedures.
  • Problem Solving - Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; Gathers and analyzes information skillfully; Develops alternative solutions.
  • Project Management – Coordinates projects; Communicates changes and progress.
  • Customer Service - Responds promptly to customer needs; Solicits customer feedback to improve service.
  • Quality Management - Looks for ways to improve and promote quality; Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness.
  • Design - Generates creative solutions; Translates concepts and information into images; Uses feedback to modify designs; Applies design principles; Demonstrates attention to detail.
  • Written Communication - Presents numerical data effectively; Able to read and interpret written information.
  • Organizational Support - Follows policies and procedures; Completes administrative tasks correctly and on time; supports organization's goals and values.
  • Reasoning Ability - Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.
  • Other Skills and Abilities
    • Basic knowledge of Database software; Development software; Internet software; Spreadsheet software and Word Processing software.
    • Hands on experience working in integrated development environments, including Visual Studio preferred.
    • Experience with Windows-Based operating systems.
    • Experience with SQL Server database.
    • Familiarity with the healthcare industry a plus
    • Working knowledge of current Internet technologies, including [N-tier architecture].
    • Hands-on software troubleshooting experience.
    • Knowledge of applicable data privacy practices and laws.
    • Knowledge of all phases of the software development life cycle
    • Familiarity with object oriented, rapid prototyping software development methodologies.



Required Experience


Education and/or Experience

  • Current rising senior, grad student or recent grad in computer science or a related field required.
  • Software Development academic courses, projects, internships and/or work experience.
  • Experience with programming languages such as HTML5, SQL, JavaScript, Angular/TypeScript, Python, Java or C#.
  • Intermediate level Microsoft Office skills to include Excel, PowerPoint and Word.

Qlarant is an Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans, and Individuals with Disabilities.

Overview:

Webasto Roof Systems Inc. is currently recruiting for an IT Site Support Intern located at their plant in Plymouth.


Job Responsibilities:

  • Support the Infrastructure and Support activities for facilities(s) of an assigned site.
  • Consults with business unit departments and/or management regarding current business technology needs / problems
  • Facilitates problem resolution by reviewing open trouble tickets, gathering additional information, updating users on status and driving the resolution process.
  • Direct contributor to service delivery.
  • Provide technical leadership for areas of specialty and responsibility as a member of the Services group.
  • Participate in assigned projects.
  • Assist with local area network and client/server operating system support as needed.
  • Manage computer communication technology
  • Manage records related to computer corporate computer environment (hardware and software)
  • Promote and adhere to policy, standards, practices, and fully participate within the change management processes.
  • Supports IT Help Desk through service delivery activities, reviewing open trouble tickets, gathering additional information, updating users on status and driving the resolution process.

Education & Experience:

  • Working toward a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field
  • Experience working with people preferred
  • Solid understanding of network architecture, desktop devices
  • Experience in LAN/WAN environment preferred
  • Experience with Microsoft products required
  • Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal skills in the English language required

Indiana Health Information Exchange's (IHIE) Solution Engineering team develops technologies that directly impact the quality, safety and efficiency of healthcare. We are seeking a Solution Engineering intern with experience in software design, implementation, testing and debugging to work with the Data Exchange Services (DES) team. Knowledge of the Java language and the ability to write simple SQL queries is essential for all applicants. If you're talented, driven, and enjoy a little fun, you'll find IHIE to be a wonderful place to work

Summary: The Solution Engineering Intern will work in an agile setting as a part of the DES team on

  • Debugging, documenting and testing existing java applications that interact with some of the largest medical data repositories in the world
  • Investigate and propose improvements to existing systems and applications
  • Write SQL queries to retrieve data samples that will be used to debug and identify issues and areas of improvement

Requirements:

  • Experience with Object Oriented methodology and best practices
  • Experience with Java exception handling
  • Understanding of design patterns such as singleton, builder and producer/consumer
  • Experience with SQL and relational databases

IHIE Attributes:

  • Adaptability and flexibility in a rapidly changing environment
  • Self-starter and self-motivated
  • Ambitious spirit – brings fresh ideas to the table and finds creative solutions to problems
  • Positive attitude with outstanding communication skills


Education:

  • Computer Science or related major required

Skills and Experience:

  • Aptitude to learn technologies quickly
  • Efficient time management and organizational skills
  • Professional demeanor
  • Ability to communicate effectively, both in verbal and written form
  • Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions as well as manage ambiguity
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team of professionals at all levels

We offer an exciting opportunity to gain valuable, real-world experience while solving some very interesting challenges. We have a very casual work environment and dress code, all in a dynamic, fun-loving company culture!

IHIE is the nation's largest and most advanced health information exchange helping to ensure health information is where it needs to be, when it needs to be there to improve care coordination and patient outcomes. IHIE was formed in 2004 and currently serves over 90 hospitals and processes more than 14 million clinical data transactions each month. Learn more at www.ihie.org.

JOB DESCRIPTION
Apex is seeking an intern to work with our Technology & Energy Assessment Team on data systems and databases capturing data from remote measurement assets that support our development projects. The intern will work with applications and analysis related to meteorological towers, anemometers and other weather sensors, SoDAR units, and operating wind turbines, and on other assignments as needed. The position internship will focus on the development of new tools and applications to assimilate large data sets and aid analysis.
RESPONSIBILITIES
  • The intern will work with applications and analysis related to meteorological towers, anemometers and other weather sensors, SoDAR units, and operating wind turbines, and on other assignments as needed.
  • The position internship will focus on the development of new tools and applications to assimilate large data sets and aid analysis.
QUALIFICATIONS
  • Masters degree candidate in Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, Programming, Systems Engineering, or Applications Development or a related field.
  • Experience with database development and operation is required.
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office is required.
  • Experience with general information technology systems is required.
  • Experience in SQL, SSIS, VBA, Python, is preferred.
  • Strong communication skills in both verbal and written form are required.
  • Previous Wind Energy or Solar Energy experience is a plus.
  • Sourcing and procurement experience is a plus.
BENEFITS
  • There are no benefits associated with this position

Point of Sale Engineering Summer Internship

Program Overview:

Our Summer Intern program offers hardworking college students an opportunity to go beyond the classroom to develop leadership skills and gain relevant hands on experience working as part of a global support team with professionals across the enterprise. Additionally, interns will participate in scheduled activities throughout the summer, including sessions with Senior Leaders, site tours, volunteer opportunities, and other social events. Fiserv interns are in session from June 2, 2021 – August 13, 2021 and work approximately 40 hours per week.

About Clover

Join the Fintech and SaaS revolution that is helping small businesses grow faster. At Clover, you will be part of an entrepreneurial team working in a fast-paced and high growth environment, with the benefits of a parent company, Fiserv that is the largest payments processor and merchant acquirer worldwide.

Clover delivers the leading Point of Sale system with an elegant end-to-end solution that incorporates beautiful devices, cloud-based POS software, payments processing, platform API’s for third-party developers, and an ecosystem with over 500 apps. The Clover platform delivers solutions in a scalable and modular fashion that powers tiny merchants through large football stadiums, supporting millions of transactions daily.

Clover’s Point of Sale Engineering Team

The Point of Sale team develops applications that are used by Clover merchants on a day to day basis. Our solutions assist business owners in the managing of orders, inventory and employees. We have solutions that are tailored for both fine dining and fast food restaurants. Clover solutions also support merchant retail and services.

What does a Clover Summer Intern do?

As an intern on the Clover Point of Sale Engineering Team, you will work on important projects of great importance to the firm. With this project, you will build a solution from the ground up that addresses a real need for Clover Engineers. It will not only help make our products perform better in the field, but also help productivity of our engineers. You will be working with experienced engineers and gain valuable insights into the software development process in a real-world environment.

What does a Clover Innovation Pod Intern do?

As an intern on the Clover Point of Sale Engineering Team, you will work in a small pod of 2-3 engineers and 1 product manager to own an initiative. With this project, you will build a solution from the ground up that addresses a real need for the Clover Team. It will not only help make our products perform better in the field, but also help productivity of our engineers. You will be working with experienced engineers and gain valuable insights into the software development process in a real-world environment.

Requirements of the Internship

  • Progress toward completion of bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Management Information Systems or related field by December 2021 / May 2023 with demonstrated academic achievement.
  • Strong programming skills, in Java, SQL, JavaScript, and Python
  • Experience / interest in Server and Web app development
  • Some Android development experience is a big plus.
  • Minimum GPA of 3.0 (3.5 or above preferred)
  • Strategic and creative thinking; distinguished written and oral communications skills
  • Collaborative, team player who can thrive in a fast-paced environment with quickly changing, ambiguous requirements
  • Strong self-starter with an intellectual curiosity

Learn more about Fiserv:

To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that provides flexibility and affordability with a variety of medical, dental, vision, life insurance and disability options.

We are #FISVProud of our benefits and well-being programs. Our commitment to wellness, wellness education, preventive services and fitness activities are designed to meet you where you are.

Life moves fast. And as it does, we know most people aren’t thinking about “financial services”. But we are.

We help people and businesses move money and information every minute of every day. Our solutions connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another, millions of times a day, behind the scenes, reliably and securely.

We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments enabling innovative financial services experiences that are in step with the way people live and work today. The company’s approximately 44,000 associates proudly serve clients in more than 100 countries, so their customers, members and consumers can move money when and where they need it, at the point of thought.

Our Aspiration is to move money and information in a way that moves the world. As a FORTUNE™ 500 company and one of FORTUNE Magazine World’s Most Admired Companies for the seventh consecutive year, we are committed to excellence and purposeful innovation.

We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran

Explore the possibilities of a career with Fiserv and Find Your Forward with us.

#FINT

position: Intern to support Children and Youth and Make a Difference!
description:
Nonprofit Internships and Volunteer Opportunities

Cause: Children and Youth

Manhattan OR Remote / Virtual / Work from Home

Many students, recent graduates, and professionals have lost (or been unable to find) internships or jobs due to COVID-19. We feel so bad for all those who have been impacted in that way.

While we cannot pay, our nonprofit does offer an outstanding opportunity to use your skills, gain experience, enhance your resume, and make a tremendous positive social impact on the causes or communities you care about, including Children and Youth.

Greatest Impact

This may be the single best opportunity for you to make the greatest possible positive impact in the world.

Who Is It For?

We have many roles to fill here, so we need high-achieving interns and volunteers with a range of experience. We therefore welcome:

· Professionals who want to volunteer part-time

· "Dependent Spouses" of H1-B, F1, and L1 visa holders

· Recent graduates, including international students on OPT

· Undergraduate and graduate school students, including international students on CPT, who want to intern or to join us as a school ambassador

· Outstanding high school students, who want to intern or to join us as a school ambassador

Credit for Students

Internships with ChangingThePresent are eligible for credit from many schools, and we are happy to do our part to meet the school's requirements.

When

We are always hiring: school year or summer; full-time or part-time.

About Us

ChangingThePresent.org is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit. The New York Times called us an “Amazon.com of the nonprofit world.”

We make the experience of a donation, which you can give in a friend’s name, feel like a rewarding present and an appealing alternative to buying and giving yet more unwanted "stuff." In this way, we are starting to channel to nonprofits some of the $450 billion Americans spend each year buying birthday, wedding, holiday, and corporate presents. Imagine how much good we could all do together as more of that money goes to making a difference.

· Our visitors can contribute to provide school children with their first book, preserve an acre of the wilderness, fund an hour of cancer research, etc.

· Wish lists and registries let them share their dreams for a better world.

· Personalized greeting cards make a charitable gift especially memorable. Gift cards let friends support the things they care about.

We already work with hundreds of the most prestigious nonprofits in the country, and we are now opening the site to all nonprofits so they can all attract additional funding for their important missions.

Unprecedented Opportunities for Responsibility and Leadership

Our interns and volunteers get more responsibility than they would anywhere else. You can take a leadership role.

Focus on Children and Youth Nonprofits

We seek high-achieving interns and volunteers who want to take a leadership role and make a difference for the cause of Children and Youth.

You can also choose to focus on your favorite causes (including education, hunger, women, children, cancer, human rights, environment, women, veterans, etc.) or the charitable needs of any ethnic group, religious group, city, or country. Please see the growing list of causes, countries, cities, ethnic groups, and religious groups on which we focus at https://changingthepresent.org/collections/gifts

For the Children and Youth and Every Cause, Interns and Volunteers Will do the Following:

· Identify, research, prioritize, and invite potential Advisors and Experts.

· Identify, research, prioritize, and invite nonprofits, who can register and list their charitable gifts at no cost. The opportunity for them is discussed in the slideshow on this page: https://changingthepresent.org/pages/for-nonprofits

· Identify, research, prioritize, and pitch magazines, websites, blogs, professional organizations, social media channels, online communities, and other ways to reach people who care about each specific cause.

· Identify, research, and pitch strategic partners for the cause.

· Identify, research, prioritize, and pitch sources of growth funding (philanthropists, corporations, or foundations)

· Conceive of and create cause marketing sponsorship proposals.

· Identify and invite the promotional support of celebrities who support the cause/community.

Focus on Ethnic, Religious, City, or Country Communities

We also have opportunities to focus on the charitable needs of any ethnic, religious, city, or country communities.

Opportunities for Most Areas of Academic / Professional Focus

We also have positions that align with a wide range of academic and professional fields, including business development, analytics, finance, accounting, technology, web development, Salesforce, database, computer science, science, STEM education, marketing, digital marketing, communications, social media, publishing, Human Resources, organizational psychology, research, education, and graphics.

Specific Markets

Some interns focus on specific markets, such as the high school market, college market, wedding market, or corporate gift market.

You Benefit

We want all our interns to get the following from their experience here:

· Make a tremendous positive impact in the world.

· Use your skills, experience, knowledge, creativity and talent.

· Assume responsibility and take a leadership role.

· Learn a tremendous amount.

· Work with people from around the world in a diverse and supportive community, and have a great time.

· Enhance your resume with a record of professional achievement and community service.

· Receive a great letter of recommendation.

When

We welcome full-time and part-time interns during the school year and/or the summer. We are entrepreneurial and flexible, and we are always hiring.

Where

Our office is conveniently located at 7th Avenue and 33 Streets in Manhattan. We also have interns who work remotely (as are all of us during the pandemic).

Please Share

We hope you will also share this opportunity with anyone who might be interested.

* *Learn More and Apply Now

Read more about our internships at:

https://ChangingThePresent.org/pages/interns-and-volunteers.

Then, please send a resume and short cover letter about your specific interests and your available dates/days/hours to: join [AT] ChangingThePresent [DOT] org.

Thank you very much!

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Internship

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekends

Work Location:

  • Fully Remote

Internship Compensation:

  • College Credit

COVID-19 Precaution(s):

  • Remote interview process
  • Virtual meetings

Summary of Internship

The Project Management job family forms part of the Project Management track within the IT function. Members of this family lead work teams, consisting of colleagues from a wide variety of functions inside and outside of IT, and assume responsibility for project initiatives. As project management professionals, incumbents contribute to the achievement of business objectives by ensuring that customer solutions are delivered on time, on budget, to the agreed upon specification, and to the customer’s overall satisfaction. The position starts in June, paid working 40 hours per week through August. Opportunity exists for this position to continue through the academic year on a part-time basis to allow for class schedules.

Essential Functions

  • All Project Manager coordinates activity for projects. Incumbents act as a liaison to the end customer and various stakeholders to communicate project activities. As the main customer contact, they support day to day delivery and direction on projects, setting and controlling customer expectations and maintaining the overall customer relationship. Under the direction of a more senior project manager, incumbents co-manage the functional and technical track leads of the project and project priorities.
  • They communicate regularly with internal and external customers, as appropriate, to ensure the delivery of high-quality service and support.
  • Project Manager has emerging project management skills. They provide day to day support on one or more small projects. Incumbents develop and maintain fully integrated project plans which specify project goals, deliverables, staffing, scheduling, risk assessment, contingency planning, resource allocation and cost analysis. They are responsible for monitoring and reporting to management on the status of project efforts and possibly accountable for controlling project plans and costs.
  • They primarily coordinate project-related tasks with internal and external customers and ensure proper implementation and completion of projects.

Skills and Abilities

  • Basic project management skills
  • Ability to work independently and as a member of a cross-functional team
  • Willingness to learn, be mentored, and improve
  • Ability to lead and effectively participate in teams.
  • Good verbal and written communication skills, with an ability to express technical concepts in audience appropriate terms
  • Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks
  • Good organizational skills, very detail oriented
  • Analytical skills for identifying and solving problems

Qualifications

  • A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Technical or Project Management related discipline, or equivalent work experience
  • Previous Internship Experience

To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States, and should not require, now or in the future, sponsorship for employment visa status.

Program Overview:

Fiserv’s Summer Internship Program offers talented college students an opportunity to go beyond the classroom to develop leadership skills and gain meaningful hands on experience working as part of a global support team with professionals across the enterprise. Additionally, interns will participate in scheduled activities throughout the summer, including sessions with Senior Leaders, team projects, and other networking opportunities. Fiserv summer interns are in session from June 2, 2021 – August 13, 2021 and work approximately 40 hours per week.


Job Description

Fiserv Summer Interns will perform duties such as gathering and organizing data to provide information for departmental projects or reports; offering innovative suggestions; accompany professional level employees on assignments; request or give information and other related duties as assigned. Assignments serve to offer practical experience and broad exposure to the organization. Specific activities vary by assignment.

Qualifications:

  • Actively pursuing a bachelor’s degree and will graduate between December 2021 and June 2023.

Data Science Internship

Program Overview:

Our Summer Intern program offers hardworking college students an opportunity to go beyond the classroom to develop leadership skills and gain relevant hands on experience working as part of a global support team with professionals across the enterprise. Additionally, interns will participate in scheduled activities throughout the summer, including sessions with Senior Leaders, site tours, volunteer opportunities, and other social events. Fiserv interns are in session from June 2, 2021 – August 13, 2021 and work approximately 40 hours per week.

About Ondot

Ondot, now part of Fiserv, has helped over 4,500 financial institutions modernize their credit and debit cards with digital technology. Over the last 10 years, Ondot has won numerous awards for its technology, and is excited to bring this innovation to Fiserv.

What does the Data Science team do?

As a member of the Data Scientist team, you will have the opportunity to work on real industry use cases, use your data science skills to discover data insights for card holders based on the analysis of a variety of data context, including card data, transaction data, merchant data, and location data, and build Data Insight products that bring intelligence to the consumer’s digital card management and card spending experience

As a Data Scientist you will:

The candidate will work on improving the Transaction Enrichment (TE) solution, and apply exploratory data analysis, statistical algorithms and machine learning algorithms to cleanse raw payment transaction data and enrich it with additional attributes, such as merchant names, locations, merchant contacts, merchant categories, logos, etc. The responsibilities include:

  • Work with managers and cross-functional product teams to create the prioritized list of data use cases and data challenges

  • Conduct independent data analysis to gain thorough understanding of the main characteristics of the data, and identify the main gaps in algorithms or the main data issues to resolve

  • Leverage data warehousing and visualization methods to create dashboards and tools for effectively performing data analysis and model evaluation

  • Recommend statistical or machine learning methods to solve the data issues

  • Process data from multiple data sources to create clean and normalized datasets for training, validation and testing

  • Execute model training, hyperparameter tuning, feature selection, and performance evaluation

Requirements of the Internship:

  • Progress toward completion of Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, or other related fields. by December 2021/ May 2023 with demonstrated academic achievement. - Master’s preferred

  • Minimum GPA of 3.0 (3.5 or above preferred)

  • Must be passionate about data: you feel a strong sense of achievement when you discover the hidden patterns within the data, the exceptions not dealt with before, the beauty of feature engineering, and the new model yielding best performance without overfitting

  • Experience or knowledge of data processing skills and abilities to deal with large amount of data

  • Experience with SQL, Python, and/or data processing pipeline

  • Experience or knowledge with machine learning models, such as classification, NLP, NER, neural network, and other deep learning algorithms using Tensorflow or PyTorch

  • Experience or knowledge in feature engineering, hyperparameter tuning, and model training

  • Extremely attentive to metric and details: precision, recall, accuracy, outliers, anomalies, trends, etc.

  • Respect data privacy and data governance rules and regulations

  • Ability to communicate clearly with different stakeholders

  • A team player who can learn and grow with other team members, while contributing to the success of the product

IT Business Analyst Intern

position: Data Science Intern - Search and Information Retrieval
description:
At Grainger, we’re committed to our purpose – We Keep the World Working. Grainger is a leading global supplier of maintenance, repair, and operational supplies, providing services and solutions for every industry. Our 25,000 employees are driven to serve customers and the community in exceptional ways, focusing on delivering the highest level of service leveraging the most innovative solutions. As part of a high-performing team, you’ll be able to develop your talents and make a difference. Grainger is a Fortune 500 company and a perennial member of Fortune magazine's Most Admired Companies list.

Grainger is a leader in data driven culture and decision making. Our Analytics & Data team operates as a center of excellence helping leaders and teams across all areas of the business make decisions based on informed insights that enhance our customer experience and improve business performance.

At Grainger, you will be working with analysts, data scientists and AI experts with very diverse backgrounds and strong technical expertise. Our team's mission is to use multiple different technology platforms to build data-driven cutting-edge solutions and capabilities using machine learning and big data with a focus on Predictive Analytics, Deep Learning, Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing, as well as other relevant areas.

\As a Data Science Intern in the Search Team, you will apply these techniques using a wealth of internal and external data to develop insights in the areas of e-commerce search and to help customer searching on Grainger.com to find products faster. Your work would directly impact end users and would influence how customers find and buy products on Grainger.com. The work that the intern does will go towards contributing to the suite of search solutions that power e-commerce search and transactions on Grainger.com

The ideal candidate for this position is someone with strong programming experience, someone with problem-solving skills and someone who is willing to research approaches to tackle new problems. The candidate should be able to work independently and be comfortable reaching out to colleagues in the larger team.

Responsibilities
  • Explore, analyze and interpret data both structured and unstructured, predominantly text
  • Perform high-impact exploratory analyses and investigations to enrich our understanding of how people interact with grainger.com over time
  • Research and develop solutions to new and challenging business problems
  • Collaborate with team members and business partners to understand their goals
  • Present and provide insights both to internal teams and stakeholders

Requirements
  • Preferably pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics or any Engineering discipline
  • Master’s degree is preferred
  • Expected graduation with a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree between Winter 2021 – Spring 2022
  • Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher
  • Significant experience with the Python programming language, In particular:
  • Familiarity with data analysis tools in Python
  • Exposure to web applications in Python
  • Experience with utilizing Machine Learning libraries in Python
  • Knowledge of relational databases and SQL
  • Passion for data analysis and excited to build data/ML solutions
  • Completing a degree, or pursuing an advanced degree in a quantitative discipline
  • Interest in ML for NLP, Search and Information Retrieval

Preferred Qualifications
  • Coursework in Algorithms, NLP, Information Retrieval, Search Engines
  • Familiarity with Web Applications, REST APIs

Grainger is an Equal Opportunity Workplace and an Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

position: Summer Intern - Cyber - Data Loss Prevention (DLP) Information Security
description:
2021 Summer Intern – Technology Majors

Program Overview:

Our Summer Intern program offers hardworking college students an opportunity to go beyond the classroom to develop leadership skills and gain relevant hands on experience working as part of a global support team with professionals across the enterprise. Additionally, interns will participate in scheduled activities throughout the summer, including sessions with Senior Leaders. Fiserv interns are in session from June 2, 2021 – August 13, 2021 and work approximately 40 hours per week.

Job Description:

Fiserv is currently looking for innovative and motivated Technology Interns to participate in the 11 week 2021 Summer Internship Program. Technology areas such as Application Development, Global & Cyber Security, Mobile Solutions, Network Engineering and Quality Assurance are offering internships; each will provide training curriculum, mentoring, and on the job experiential learning.

The Data Loss Prevention (DLP) Information Security – Analyst Intern will perform analysis on incidents and events within the data protection environment including, but not limited to, incidents from Symantec DLP. This position is responsible for partnering with DLP engineering and Digital Investigations for Cyber investigations. This position will provide incident and policy analysis for existing controls and help drive expansion for greater data visibility and loss prevention technologies in the information security environment. The InfoSec Analyst is expected to work independently with internal associates and management on information security issues and reporting. In addition, the candidate should have an understanding of data loss protection concepts and incident analysis and be able to relay findings as needed.

Qualifications:

  • Progress towards completion of bachelor's degree by December 2021 / May 2023 with demonstrated academic achievement
  • Minimum GPA of 3.0 (3.5 or above preferred)
  • Must be highly ethical and act honorably, honestly, responsibly, and legally.
  • Must be able to weigh business needs against security concerns and articulate issues to associates and management.
  • Have strong analytical, technical, and problem-solving skills.
  • Prior experience with incident triage and escalation
  • Strong technical writing skills in order to convey information concisely and effectively.
  • Able to manage time and priorities with multiple tasks/projects, and be able to prioritize when impromptu tasks arise
  • Demonstrate leadership qualities and skills, including independent decision-making abilities.
  • Ability to analyze data and provide intelligent summarizations
  • A solid understanding of Risk and Security controls and mechanisms
  • Experience with large scale global security applications - preferred
  • A solid understanding of Network and Endpoint Systems Scanning - preferred
  • Able to work with other engineers and departments in a positive, goal-directed manner Strategic and creative thinking; distinguished written and oral communications skills.
  • Military-Affiliated applicants encouraged to apply (Veterans, Military Spouses, and Guard/Reservists)
  • Must possess unrestricted work authorization and not require future sponsorship

Majors:

A wide range of college majors are considered based on specific needs of department such as: Computer Science/Network Engineering, Engineering, Mathematics, MIS, and STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Math), but willing to train the right candidate.

2021 Summer Intern – Technology Majors

Program Overview:

Our Summer Intern program offers hardworking college students an opportunity to go beyond the classroom to develop leadership skills and gain relevant hands on experience working as part of a global support team with professionals across the enterprise. Additionally, interns will participate in scheduled activities throughout the summer, including sessions with Senior Leaders, site tours, volunteer opportunities, and other social events. Fiserv interns are in session from June 2, 2021 – August 13, 2021 and work approximately 40 hours per week.

Job Description:

Fiserv is currently looking for innovative and motivated Technology and Product Interns to participate in the 10 week 2020 Summer Internship Program. Technology areas such as Application Development, Global & Cyber Security, Mobile Solutions, Network Engineering and Quality Assurance are offering internships; each will provide training curriculum, mentoring, and on the job experiential learning.

Interns will work with Technology professionals learning much needed skills such as coding, testing and support application software; work with senior analysts and experienced teammates; offer innovative suggestions; participate in quality inspections; support in ongoing documentation of existing process, with mentorship, and other complicated projects. Assignments serve to offer practical experience and broad exposure to the organization. Specific activities vary by assignment.

Qualifications:

  • Progress towards completion of bachelor's degree by December 2021 / May 2023 with demonstrated academic achievement

  • Minimum GPA of 3.0 (3.5 or above preferred)

  • Interest in learning and using emerging technologies (Mobile, payments, cloud computing, information security, and converging markets

  • Understanding of development processes and life cycles preferred (Waterfall and SCRUM/Agile)

  • Must have advanced Excel and PowerPoint knowledge

  • Strategic and creative thinking; distinguished written and oral communications skills

Desired Technical Qualifications, expertise not required:

  • Microsoft .NET (required)

  • C#

  • ASP .NET

  • Java Script

  • VB. NET

Majors:

Computer Science or Computer Technology related studies preferred.

UXUI Design Internship

Program Overview:

Our Summer Intern program offers hardworking college students an opportunity to go beyond the classroom to develop leadership skills and gain relevant hands on experience working as part of a global support team with professionals across the enterprise. Additionally, interns will participate in scheduled activities throughout the summer, including sessions with Senior Leaders, site tours, volunteer opportunities, and other social events. Fiserv interns are in session from June 2, 2021 – August 13, 2021 and work approximately 40 hours per week.

About Ondot

Ondot, now part of Fiserv, has helped over 4,500 financial institutions modernize their credit and debit cards with digital technology. Over the last 10 years, Ondot has won numerous awards for its technology, and is excited to bring this innovation to Fiserv

The ideal candidate will be:

  • Obsessed about user experience and user-centric design.

  • An undergraduate or graduate student pursuing a degree in human computer interaction, industrial design, human factors, psychology, or related fields.

  • A motivated individual, who is passionate about advocating for, and empathizing for end users.

  • Have experience collaborating with designers to create research prototypes or other materials.

  • You can adapt and work well in a dynamic environment with rapidly changing priorities.

  • An active listener with a passion for understanding human behavior

  • A solid foundation and understanding of research methods used for uncovering customer insights

  • Have a good understanding of various UX research activities, and some experience supporting or conducting activities such as interviews and usability tests.

  • Have experience observing and note-taking during user research sessions

  • A collaborative, team player who has experience working effectively with others

  • You have some experience with qualitative and quantitative data analysis, and can make recommendations based on these observations.

  • You can summarize and communicate research findings with stakeholders and team members.

  • You are comfortable handling recruiting efforts, reaching out to potential participants by email or phone, and scheduling sessions.

  • Clearly communicate research findings with a strategic voice, with prioritized recommendations and potential design solutions to developers, designers, and project sponsors through visually compelling presentations and documents

  • Ability to use tools for user testing and follow Design thinking methodology.

Requirements of the Internship:

  • Progress toward completion of Bachelor's/Master’s degree in Computer Science, or other related fields by December 2021/ May 2023 with demonstrated academic achievement.

  • Minimum GPA of 3.0 (3.5 or above preferred)

  • Pursuing a UX Certificate preferred but not required

  • Understanding of Human Computer Interface or Psychology with special interest in Customer experience

  • Background or experience in writing, language or communication

  • Background or experience with design (i.e. Sketch and Figma)

  • Strong written and oral communication skills

  • Curiosity and willingness to ask a lot of questions

position: Summer Intern - Global Cyber Security Services & Fraud
description:
Job Description:

Our Summer Intern program offers hardworking college students an opportunity to go beyond the classroom to develop leadership skills and gain relevant hands on experience working as part of a global support team with professionals across the enterprise. Additionally, interns will participate in scheduled activities throughout the summer, including sessions with Senior Leaders, site tours, volunteer opportunities, and other social events. Fiserv interns are in session from June 2, 2021 – August 13, 2021 and work approximately 40 hours per week.

About the Role:

This Summer Internship position is with the Global Cyber Security Services & Fraud Team. This team ensures the secure operation of business application systems and provides protection services that are monitored, measured and includes analytics for Fiserv’s clients.

Job Duties for the Role Includes:

  • Assisting the team in implementing protection service for Internet facing websites, mobile applications, web services or networks.
  • Assisting & providing coordination for asset information and artifact gathering.
  • Perform Protective Technology Configuration and assess security posture through testing and assessment.
  • Assisting the Business Staff in determining the level of protection currently implemented for their assets.

Candidates in this role will have the opportunity to:

  • Opportunity to work for the World's Biggest Fintech & Payments Company, named 65th in the annual FORTUNE® 500 ranking, spread across 80+ Countries.
  • Work with a Team of highly skilled Cyber Security Staff, Ex-Servicemen, Vendors and Contractors
  • Gain hands-on experience with some of the most cutting-edge technology that is available in the Industry
  • Exposure to Senior and Mid-Senior levels to drive Cyber Security Projects
  • Recommendation letter from the mentor as well as the Group Director after successfully completing Internship

Qualifications:

  • Pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Cyber Security, Computer Engineering, Computer Sciences, MIS or related field.
  • 3.0+ GPA, preferred
  • Excellent Communication & Organization Skills
    Willingness to learn New Technologies
  • Conversant in IP addressing, OSI & TCP/IP model, Networking, Routing, Firewalls and CDN Networks
  • Knowledge on OWASP Top 10, TLS, Cipher Suites and other basic Cryptography functions would be a plus
  • Basic knowledge on Python, Rest APIs and XML would be good
  • Candidate perusing an associate or bachelor’s degree in STEM
  • Candidates encouraged to apply (Veterans, Military Spouses, and Guard/Reservists)
  • Must possess unrestricted work authorization and not require future sponsorship

position: Intern to support Global Health and Make a Difference!
description:
Nonprofit Internships and Volunteer Opportunities

Cause: Global Health

Manhattan OR Remote / Virtual / Work from Home

Many students, recent graduates, and professionals have lost (or been unable to find) internships or jobs due to COVID-19. We feel so bad for all those who have been impacted in that way.

While we cannot pay, our nonprofit does offer an outstanding opportunity to use your skills, gain experience, enhance your resume, and make a tremendous positive social impact on the causes or communities you care about, including Global Health.

Greatest Impact

This may be the single best opportunity for you to make the greatest possible positive impact in the world.

Who Is It For?

We have many roles to fill here, so we need high-achieving interns and volunteers with a range of experience. We therefore welcome:

· Professionals who want to volunteer part-time

· "Dependent Spouses" of H1-B, F1, and L1 visa holders

· Recent graduates, including international students on OPT

· Undergraduate and graduate school students, including international students on CPT, who want to intern or to join us as a school ambassador

· Outstanding high school students, who want to intern or to join us as a school ambassador

Credit for Students

Internships with ChangingThePresent are eligible for credit from many schools, and we are happy to do our part to meet the school's requirements.

When

We are always hiring: school year or summer; full-time or part-time.

About Us

ChangingThePresent.org is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit. The New York Times called us an “Amazon.com of the nonprofit world.”

We make the experience of a donation, which you can give in a friend’s name, feel like a rewarding present and an appealing alternative to buying and giving yet more unwanted "stuff." In this way, we are starting to channel to nonprofits some of the $450 billion Americans spend each year buying birthday, wedding, holiday, and corporate presents. Imagine how much good we could all do together as more of that money goes to making a difference.

· Our visitors can contribute to provide school children with their first book, preserve an acre of the wilderness, fund an hour of cancer research, etc.

· Wish lists and registries let them share their dreams for a better world.

· Personalized greeting cards make a charitable gift especially memorable. Gift cards let friends support the things they care about.

We already work with hundreds of the most prestigious nonprofits in the country, and we are now opening the site to all nonprofits so they can all attract additional funding for their important missions.

Unprecedented Opportunities for Responsibility and Leadership

Our interns and volunteers get more responsibility than they would anywhere else. You can take a leadership role.

Focus on Global Health Nonprofits

We seek high-achieving interns and volunteers who want to take a leadership role and make a difference for the cause of Global Health.

You can also choose to focus on your favorite causes (including education, hunger, women, children, cancer, human rights, environment, women, veterans, etc.) or the charitable needs of any ethnic group, religious group, city, or country. Please see the growing list of causes, countries, cities, ethnic groups, and religious groups on which we focus at https://changingthepresent.org/collections/gifts

For the Global Health and Every Cause, Interns and Volunteers Will do the Following:

· Identify, research, prioritize, and invite potential Advisors and Experts.

· Identify, research, prioritize, and invite nonprofits, who can register and list their charitable gifts at no cost. The opportunity for them is discussed in the slideshow on this page: https://changingthepresent.org/pages/for-nonprofits

· Identify, research, prioritize, and pitch magazines, websites, blogs, professional organizations, social media channels, online communities, and other ways to reach people who care about each specific cause.

· Identify, research, and pitch strategic partners for the cause.

· Identify, research, prioritize, and pitch sources of growth funding (philanthropists, corporations, or foundations)

· Conceive of and create cause marketing sponsorship proposals.

· Identify and invite the promotional support of celebrities who support the cause/community.

Focus on Ethnic, Religious, City, or Country Communities

We also have opportunities to focus on the charitable needs of any ethnic, religious, city, or country communities.

Opportunities for Most Areas of Academic / Professional Focus

We also have positions that align with a wide range of academic and professional fields, including business development, analytics, finance, accounting, technology, web development, Salesforce, database, computer science, science, STEM education, marketing, digital marketing, communications, social media, publishing, Human Resources, organizational psychology, research, education, and graphics.

Specific Markets

Some interns focus on specific markets, such as the high school market, college market, wedding market, or corporate gift market.

You Benefit

We want all our interns to get the following from their experience here:

· Make a tremendous positive impact in the world.

· Use your skills, experience, knowledge, creativity and talent.

· Assume responsibility and take a leadership role.

· Learn a tremendous amount.

· Work with people from around the world in a diverse and supportive community, and have a great time.

· Enhance your resume with a record of professional achievement and community service.

· Receive a great letter of recommendation.

When

We welcome full-time and part-time interns during the school year and/or the summer. We are entrepreneurial and flexible, and we are always hiring.

Where

Our office is conveniently located at 7th Avenue and 33 Streets in Manhattan. We also have interns who work remotely (as are all of us during the pandemic).

Please Share

We hope you will also share this opportunity with anyone who might be interested.

* *Learn More and Apply Now

Read more about our internships at:

https://ChangingThePresent.org/pages/interns-and-volunteers.

Then, please send a resume and short cover letter about your specific interests and your available dates/days/hours to: join [AT] ChangingThePresent [DOT] org.

Thank you very much!

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Internship

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekends

Work Location:

  • Fully Remote

Internship Compensation:

  • College Credit

COVID-19 Precaution(s):

  • Remote interview process
  • Virtual meetings

position: 2021 Summer Intern - Global Brand and Communications - Creative Services
description:
Program Overview:

Fiserv’s Summer Internship Program offers talented college students an opportunity to go beyond the classroom to develop leadership skills and gain meaningful hands on experience working as part of a global support team with professionals across the enterprise. Additionally, interns will participate in scheduled activities throughout the summer, including sessions with Senior Leaders, team projects, and other networking opportunities. Fiserv summer interns are in session from June 2, 2021 – August 13, 2021 and work approximately 40 hours per week.


Job Description

Fiserv Summer Interns will perform duties such as gathering and organizing data to provide information for departmental projects or reports; offering innovative suggestions; accompany professional level employees on assignments; request or give information and other related duties as assigned. Assignments serve to offer practical experience and broad exposure to the organization.

Creative Services is responsible for creative development and strategy for Global Brand and support Business Unit's throughout the company with branding and design for print materials, events, digital assets and marketing collateral.

Qualifications:

  • Actively pursuing a bachelor’s degree and will graduate between December 2021 and June 2023.
  • 3.0+ GPA preferred
  • Must have advanced Excel and PowerPoint knowledge and technical aptitude to learn new applications quickly
  • Graphic Design, Advertising, Exhibit Design or Illustrator major
  • Basic knowledge of layouts, typography, line composition, color, and other graphic design fundamentals
  • Experience using the Adobe Creative Cloud software including InDesign, Photoshop and Illustrator
  • Strong creative and analytical skills
  • Experience using animation software such as After Effects is a plus
  • Military-Affiliated candidates encouraged to apply (Veterans, Military Spouses, and Guard/Reservists)
  • Must possess unrestricted work authorization and not require future sponsorship

Majors:

A wide range of bachelor’s degree programs considered, based upon specific department needs, such as: Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Data Analytics, Finance, Economics, Accounting, Business Administration, Mathematics, Supply Chain, Human Resources, Purchasing, Sales and Communications

Please Note: Where we encourage you to apply now, our 2021 summer internship interview process begins in December and will continue through April. You can expect to hear from one of our recruiters if your qualifications

align.

Learn more about Fiserv:

To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that provides flexibility and affordability with a variety of medical, dental, vision, life insurance and disability options.

We are #FISVProud of our benefits and well-being programs. Our commitment to wellness, wellness education, preventive services and fitness activities are designed to meet you where you are.

Life moves fast. And as it does, we know most people aren’t thinking about “financial services”. But we are.

We help people and businesses move money and information every minute of every day. Our solutions connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another, millions of times a day, behind the scenes, reliably and securely.

We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments enabling innovative financial services experiences that are in step with the way people live and work today. The company’s approximately 44,000 associates proudly serve clients in more than 100 countries, so their customers, members and consumers can move money when and where they need it, at the point of thought.

Our Aspiration is to move money and information in a way that moves the world. As a FORTUNE™ 500 company and one of FORTUNE Magazine World’s Most Admired Companies for the seventh consecutive year, we are committed to excellence and purposeful innovation.

We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

#FSINT

Program Overview:

Our Summer Intern program offers hardworking college students an opportunity to go beyond the classroom to develop leadership skills and gain relevant hands on experience working as part of a global support team with professionals across the enterprise. Additionally, interns will participate in scheduled activities throughout the summer, including sessions with Senior Leaders, site tours, volunteer opportunities, and other social events. Fiserv interns are in session from June 2, 2021 – August 13, 2021 and work approximately 40 hours per week.

About the Role:

Are you fascinated by the news of hackers breaching your favorite mobile apps or websites, and are ready to learn how to find / fix these weaknesses?

Do you have a passion for researching technology security, hacking, mobile apps, automation, and related industry trends?

Are you an innovator, who will proactively identify issues and appropriate escalation paths, with mitigation and strategies for resolution?

Then this Summer Internship role may be for you!

  • Working with application development teams to implement tools into the SDLC (SAST/DAST and Open Source)
  • Supporting appsec engineering on infrastructure that hosts application security tools
  • Supporting devsecops and process automation

Qualifications

  • Progress towards completion of bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Management Information Systems or Risk Management by December 2021 / May 2023 with demonstrated academic achievement
  • Minimum GPA of 3.0 (3.5 or above preferred)
  • Interest in learning and using emerging technologies (Mobile, payments, cloud computing, information security, and converging markets)
  • Knowledge of web application development, systems administration, and /or code auditing
  • Understanding of web application security threats, exploits and prevention
  • Passion for researching vulnerabilities, exploitation techniques and industry trends/threats
  • Knowledge of development / scripting languages (JAVA, .NET, Python, etc.)
  • Military-Affiliated candidates encouraged to apply (Veterans, Military Spouses, and Guard/Reservists)
  • Must possess unrestricted work authorization and not require future sponsorship

Desired Technical Qualifications, expertise not required (one of):

  • Microsoft .NET
  • C#
  • ASP .NET
  • Java
  • Java Script
  • JCL
  • Oracle
  • Linux

Learn more about Fiserv:

To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that provides flexibility and affordability with a variety of medical, dental, vision, life insurance and disability options.

We are #FISVProud of our benefits and well-being programs. Our commitment to wellness, wellness education, preventive services and fitness activities are designed to meet you where you are.

Life moves fast. And as it does, we know most people aren’t thinking about “financial services”. But we are.

We help people and businesses move money and information every minute of every day. Our solutions connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another, millions of times a day, behind the scenes, reliably and securely.

We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments enabling innovative financial services experiences that are in step with the way people live and work today. The company’s approximately 44,000 associates proudly serve clients in more than 100 countries, so their customers, members and consumers can move money when and where they need it, at the point of thought.

Our Aspiration is to move money and information in a way that moves the world. As a FORTUNE™ 500 company and one of FORTUNE Magazine World’s Most Admired Companies for the seventh consecutive year, we are committed to excellence and purposeful innovation.

We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran

Explore the possibilities of a career with Fiserv and Find Your Forward with us.

#FINT

position: Intern to focus on Fire and EMS and Make a Difference!
description:
Nonprofit Internships and Volunteer Opportunities

Cause: Fire and EMS

Manhattan OR Remote / Virtual / Work from Home

Many students, recent graduates, and professionals have lost (or been unable to find) internships or jobs due to COVID-19. We feel so bad for all those who have been impacted in that way.

While we cannot pay, our nonprofit does offer an outstanding opportunity to use your skills, gain experience, enhance your resume, and make a tremendous positive social impact on the causes or communities you care about, including Fire and EMS.

Greatest Impact

This may be the single best opportunity for you to make the greatest possible positive impact in the world.

Who Is It For?

We have many roles to fill here, so we need high-achieving interns and volunteers with a range of experience. We therefore welcome:

· Professionals who want to volunteer part-time

· "Dependent Spouses" of H1-B, F1, and L1 visa holders

· Recent graduates, including international students on OPT

· Undergraduate and graduate school students, including international students on CPT, who want to intern or to join us as a school ambassador

· Outstanding high school students, who want to intern or to join us as a school ambassador

Credit for Students

Internships with ChangingThePresent are eligible for credit from many schools, and we are happy to do our part to meet the school's requirements.

When

We are always hiring: school year or summer; full-time or part-time.

About Us

ChangingThePresent.org is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit. The New York Times called us an “Amazon.com of the nonprofit world.”

We make the experience of a donation, which you can give in a friend’s name, feel like a rewarding present and an appealing alternative to buying and giving yet more unwanted "stuff." In this way, we are starting to channel to nonprofits some of the $450 billion Americans spend each year buying birthday, wedding, holiday, and corporate presents. Imagine how much good we could all do together as more of that money goes to making a difference.

· Our visitors can contribute to provide school children with their first book, preserve an acre of the wilderness, fund an hour of cancer research, etc.

· Wish lists and registries let them share their dreams for a better world.

· Personalized greeting cards make a charitable gift especially memorable. Gift cards let friends support the things they care about.

We already work with hundreds of the most prestigious nonprofits in the country, and we are now opening the site to all nonprofits so they can all attract additional funding for their important missions.

Unprecedented Opportunities for Responsibility and Leadership

Our interns and volunteers get more responsibility than they would anywhere else. You can take a leadership role.

Focus on Fire and EMS Nonprofits

We seek high-achieving interns and volunteers who want to take a leadership role and make a difference for the cause of Fire and EMS.

You can also choose to focus on your favorite causes (including education, hunger, women, children, cancer, human rights, environment, women, veterans, etc.) or the charitable needs of any ethnic group, religious group, city, or country. Please see the growing list of causes, countries, cities, ethnic groups, and religious groups on which we focus at https://changingthepresent.org/collections/gifts

For the Fire and EMS and Every Cause, Interns and Volunteers Will do the Following:

· Identify, research, prioritize, and invite potential Advisors and Experts.

· Identify, research, prioritize, and invite nonprofits, who can register and list their charitable gifts at no cost. The opportunity for them is discussed in the slideshow on this page: https://changingthepresent.org/pages/for-nonprofits

· Identify, research, prioritize, and pitch magazines, websites, blogs, professional organizations, social media channels, online communities, and other ways to reach people who care about each specific cause.

· Identify, research, and pitch strategic partners for the cause.

· Identify, research, prioritize, and pitch sources of growth funding (philanthropists, corporations, or foundations)

· Conceive of and create cause marketing sponsorship proposals.

· Identify and invite the promotional support of celebrities who support the cause/community.

Focus on Ethnic, Religious, City, or Country Communities

We also have opportunities to focus on the charitable needs of any ethnic, religious, city, or country communities.

Opportunities for Most Areas of Academic / Professional Focus

We also have positions that align with a wide range of academic and professional fields, including business development, analytics, finance, accounting, technology, web development, Salesforce, database, computer science, science, STEM education, marketing, digital marketing, communications, social media, publishing, Human Resources, organizational psychology, research, education, and graphics.

Specific Markets

Some interns focus on specific markets, such as the high school market, college market, wedding market, or corporate gift market.

You Benefit

We want all our interns to get the following from their experience here:

· Make a tremendous positive impact in the world.

· Use your skills, experience, knowledge, creativity and talent.

· Assume responsibility and take a leadership role.

· Learn a tremendous amount.

· Work with people from around the world in a diverse and supportive community, and have a great time.

· Enhance your resume with a record of professional achievement and community service.

· Receive a great letter of recommendation.

When

We welcome full-time and part-time interns during the school year and/or the summer. We are entrepreneurial and flexible, and we are always hiring.

Where

Our office is conveniently located at 7th Avenue and 33 Streets in Manhattan. We also have interns who work remotely (as are all of us during the pandemic).

Please Share

We hope you will also share this opportunity with anyone who might be interested.

* *Learn More and Apply Now

Read more about our internships at:

https://ChangingThePresent.org/pages/interns-and-volunteers.

Then, please send a resume and short cover letter about your specific interests and your available dates/days/hours to: join [AT] ChangingThePresent [DOT] org.

Thank you very much!

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Internship

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekends

Work Location:

  • Fully Remote

Internship Compensation:

  • College Credit

COVID-19 Precaution(s):

  • Remote interview process
  • Virtual meetings
