Overview:
Why Consider JAGGAER?

JAGGAER is the world's leading provider of comprehensive source-to-pay solutions. Some of the largest commercial, manufacturing and life sciences companies and government organizations in the world trust JAGGAER with billions of dollars of annual spend. JAGGAER eProcurement and strategic sourcing customers across the globe have gained access to the best suppliers, with the best terms, on our scalable, customizable, user-friendly platform. Our SaaS-based, source-to-settle solution provides unparalleled visibility, insights and recommendations to procurement leaders and suppliers. The result is a fluid supply chain driven by powerful spend analysis, comprehensive contract management and efficient accounts payable solutions.

What We’re Looking For:

We are seeking a Quality Assurance (QA) intern to learn with our QA team and perform functional testing on our state-of-the-art procurement software service. Along with performing functional testing, you may have the opportunity to learn the basis of automation techniques and scripting, and perhaps complete discrete assignments with the automation team.
Functional testing is a type of user testing that is conducted by test feeding inputs into or performing operations of software to check for compliance with development requirements. This is non-code testing that will be performed primarily as part of an agile Scrum team.
Automation testing uses script automation to test code performance. Learning in this area may be performed as part of scrum team testing; but will be in conjunction with the QA automation team and may be done also outside of a Scrum team.
This position is part of an eight week internship program, consisting of 30 hour work weeks Monday-Friday. As a our QA intern, here are a few exciting things you can expect during your time with JAGGAER:
  • Working with staff QAs, youwill have responsibilities primarily of performing functional test of actual software on given environments, towards production, just as a regular staff QA. They will also learn and may begin over time to take on responsibilities of designing and implementing tests, and to debug and define corrective actions. You will also review system requirements and track quality assurance and outcome metric.
  • Reporting to a Product Owner and or Product Development Manager, you will learn about Agile and Scrum procedures, take part in various of its ceremonies and learn about the development life cycle process. The intern will also receive various assignments in support of these processes, in conducting documentation and technical writing, and otherwise assisting in the conduct of the team, as assigned.
  • Ultimately the successful candidate will be responsible for conducting tests before product launches to ensure software feature effectiveness, and that it meets requirements. Simultaneously you will learn the software development life cycle in a real development environment; while gaining experience in resolving system malfunctions to meet quality standards.
Principal Responsibilities:

Awesome things you’ll do:

  • Review requirements, specifications and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback
  • Learn to create detailed, comprehensive and well-structured test plans and test cases
  • Will learn the use of industry standard Agile software to identify, record, document and track bugs
  • Perform regression testing when bugs are resolved
  • Learn new testing tools and test strategies
  • May have opportunity to develop and execute automation scripts using open source tools
  • Due to Covid-19 safety protocols, you will get to experience first-hand how software teams have shifted to working remotely yet maintaining collaboration and teamwork
Position Requirements:

What you’ll bring:

  • Excitement for learning something new and being an important part of a small, focused team
  • 2+ years in a Business Information Systems or Computer Science degree seeking program
  • Interest in becoming a software QA, BA, software designer or software developer
  • Demonstration of basic knowledge of the software development life cycle
  • Knowledge of basic code writing principles
  • Basic knowledge of HTML, SQL and scripting
  • Willing to learn Agile Scrum development process and QA testing techniques
JAGGAER offers equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, veteran or military status and other protected class characteristics.

IT Intern - Software Development
Chicago, IL



The American Medical Association (AMA), a nonprofit, is the nation's largest professional Association of physicians. We are a unifying voice and powerful ally for America's physicians, the patients they care for, and the promise of a healthier nation. To be part of the AMA is to be part of our Mission to promote the art and science of medicine and the betterment of public health.


As an employer, we are dedicated to many efforts, including employee learning and development, social responsibility, diversity and inclusion and wellness.

Our well-defined culture has strongly impacted the prosperity of our organization. Our foundational values of Respect, Integrity, Innovation, Impact, Collaboration, Agility, Equity, and Trust are at the core of our efforts and continue to shape the success of the AMA.


We have an opportunity at our corporate offices in Chicago for an IT Intern - Software Development on our Information Technology team. As an intern you will have the opportunity to work with our team of developers to learn about application development and processes. If you want exposure to real world projects and the drive to learn new exciting technology, you want to join our team. Some responsibilities will include research, testing, and development for a large suite of web applications.


RESPONSIBILITIES:


  • Learn about our agile process, git workflows, code reviews, ticket writing and testing. Provide support, research, analysis and recommendations into extending coverage, leveraging tools and improving processes.
  • Research and present an effective documentation repository for team and code best practices and standards. Convert existing documentation into the new solution.
  • Work with various members of the team to learn about front end and back end development, business analysis, requirements gathering and application architecture.
  • Present a Learning Session to the team at the completion of the internship on the topic of your choosing, based on the skills and research acquired during the duration of the internship.
  • Report project status regularly to assigned project manager. Document concerns, issues and risks and recommended solutions regarding assignments to management.

May include other responsibilities as assigned.

REQUIREMENTS:


  • Completion of at least two years toward a BS degree in computer science or related field is required.
  • Understanding how to execute well-formed SQL for data retrieval is needed. Some knowledge and understanding of data and database technology a plus.
  • Some understanding of the systems development life cycle (SDLC) and some familiarity with both waterfall and iterative methodologies, such as AGILE, is a plus.
  • Ability to collect and analyze specific business requirements and work with the team to assess the software solution using Excel, SQL, Teams, Data Tools or related technologies.
  • Ability to work well with people from some different disciplines with varying degrees of technical experience and levels within the organization.
  • Ability to express concepts effectively verbally and in writing. Ability to learn, document, and successfully retain new skills to serve as temporary backup in various collaboration support areas as required.
  • Ability to thinking analytically with data.
  • Strong interpersonal and presentation skills, with experience communicating to stakeholders in both technical and non-technical fields.
  • Passionate about producing high-quality technology solutions.
  • Must possess a good sense of humor, and a positive, “can-do” attitude.
  • Must be flexible regarding work assignments and work independently with limited supervision

Overview:
Why Consider JAGGAER?

JAGGAER is the world's leading provider of comprehensive source-to-pay solutions. Some of the largest commercial, manufacturing and life sciences companies and government organizations in the world trust JAGGAER with billions of dollars of annual spend. JAGGAER eProcurement and strategic sourcing customers across the globe have gained access to the best suppliers, with the best terms, on our scalable, customizable, user-friendly platform. Our SaaS-based, source-to-settle solution provides unparalleled visibility, insights and recommendations to procurement leaders and suppliers. The result is a fluid supply chain driven by powerful spend analysis, comprehensive contract management and efficient accounts payable solutions.

What We’re Looking For:

As our Business Analyst intern, you will work with a Scrum development team to learn business operations, requirements gathering, business case and user story development and quality assurance testing. You will take part in various aspects of the software development life cycle for product feature development and delivery on his/her assigned team; from need determination, to intake of customer requirements, to reviewing that development output meets requirements, to post-development documentation, and more.
As stated by QAT Global “The business analyst works with the stakeholders to analyze and document business processes for the system to be developed, determine functional requirements and high-level features, elaborate on the details of the software project and requirements to set the direction of the project, and support its implementation.”

This position is part of an eight week internship program, consisting of 30 hour work weeks Monday-Friday. As a our BA ntern, here are a few exciting things you can expect during your time with JAGGAER:
  • Working with a Scrum team Product Owner (PO), you will have responsibilities in conducting business systems analysis for your Scrum team. You will learn and perform work processes from documenting requirements gathering from internal and external customers all the way through participating in some QA of the final product features. Additionally, you will work in a downstream function from the PO, to learn the career path to product owner; but also, to be eligible for an entry level Scrum team role in quality assurance, business analysis or other similar available position upon graduation.
  • Reporting to a Product Owner and or Product Development Manager this intern will learn about Agile and Scrum procedures, take part in various of its ceremonies, and learn about the life cycle development process. The intern will also receive various assignments in support of these processes, in conducting documentation and technical writing, and otherwise assisting in the conduct of the team, as assigned.
Principal Responsibilities:

Awesome things you’ll do:

  • Review requirements, specifications and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback
  • Document requirement gathering with business users and technical team to capture the requirements and use cases.
  • Detailed documentation preparation for requirements, use cases, functional requirements, and non- functional requirements.
  • Support in providing analysis, modeling, and other quantitative techniques as needed to answer business questions and evaluate business issues and objections.
  • May learn and apply user interface prototype development or designing UI mockups; but not a regular function
  • Process flow development and diagraming
  • Will develop basic Project Management skills and learn to provide project progress updates to project stakeholders.
  • Due to Covid-19 safety protocols, you will get to experience first-hand how teams have shifted to working remotely yet maintaining collaboration and teamwork
Position Requirements:

What you’ll bring:

  • Excitement for learning something new and being an important part of a small, focused team
  • At least 2 years completed in a bachelor's degree seeking program
  • Major of study in computer science, business information systems, commercial design or computer graphics for software, project management, business administration, analytics, or other general majors where your course of study includes a focus and interest in technology
  • Or Recent graduate of a Coding Bootcamp or other computer technology program, or professional management certification such as Six Sigma or Agile certification
  • Strong analytical skills, work ethic, independence, problem solving ability, effective communication skills, and overall positive attitude
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Excel; in particular formula writing
  • Basic SQL ability not required, but a plus (demonstrated acumen to learn is necessary)
  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to multi-task
  • Interest in becoming a software QA, BA, software designer or software developer
  • Demonstration of basic knowledge of the software development life cycle
  • Knowledge of basic code writing principles
  • Willing to learn Agile Scrum development process
JAGGAER offers equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, veteran or military status and other protected class characteristics.

CIVIC Financial Services is a private money lender, specializing in the financing of non-owner occupied residential investment properties. CIVIC has funded over $4.0 Billion in loans since its inception, providing Mortgage Brokers and Real Estate Investors with a fast, cost effective funding source for their real estate investment needs.

CIVIC is committed to creating a workplace where our people thrive, which translates into a culture of inclusion, recognition, and success for our teammates and clients alike. Since 2016, CIVIC has been recognized by Best Workplaces and Fortune as a Great Place to Work, and CIVIC’s employee engagement ranks among the top 5% of companies nationally.

Whether you are an entrepreneur, an innovator, a game changer, a creative, a problem-solver, a thinker, or an operator we have all kinds. CIVIC is the place for smart, ambitious, dedicated people who work hard and play nice.

Yes, our business is in real estate investing... but our greatest investment is in you!

What's in it for you:


We have a strong focus on going above and beyond when it comes to caring for our team members and our communities. In addition to traditional benefits like health insurance, casual Fridays, paid vacation, holidays and sick leave, we’re proud to offer these unique and enriching work perks:

  • Celebrations: When we say we “work hard and play hard,” we mean it! We like to celebrate often via onsite and offsite happy hours, themed parties, parking lot BBQ's, milestone ceremonies, pot lucks, and Workout Tuesdays (to name a few).
  • Investments: As we're in the lending space, we believe we should consistently and frequently invest in our CIVIC team. We give away money every month to help our teammates pay off student debts, participate in our loan and lending accounts, and reward them for their “grand ideas” that make CIVIC better.
  • Comfortable Spaces: We like to make sure our teammates are well fed and can “find their zen” while at the office. Our kitchens are stocked with free snacks and beverages, in addition to catered breakfasts on Fridays and catered lunches multiple days per month. Many of our branches also have dedicated break spaces that are quiet, serene and perfect for relaxing.
  • Education: Every other Tuesday, we encourage our team to take “900 Seconds of Genius" (15 minutes) to focus on a passion project or topic that helps them grow. We also offer an online curriculum of courses through our own CIVIC University.
  • #CIVICCares Initiative: From beach cleanups, to food and clothing drives, to building homes for Habitat for Humanity, CIVIC provides several opportunities throughout the year for our team to step outside the office, bond, and come together to give back to our local communities.


CIVIC is an Equal Opportunity Employer and welcomes applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

position: Research Intern: Analytics for Cyber Defense
description:
We are looking for a summer intern to contribute to our research activities by applying modern data analytics and machine learning techniques on a variety of structured and unstructured data in the field of Industrial Control Systems Security. As intern in this project, you will be responsible for developing new algorithms and prototype code as proof of concept for novel ideas in the field of OT (Operational Technology) cyber defense.

This task includes researching supervised and unsupervised methods and models for automatically findings non-linear correlation patterns in the domain of security anomaly and intrusion detection. You will work with high-fidelity simulation and lab-emulated data to perform the research in close collaboration with domain experts in the field of OT security and data scientists. In addition, you will learn about general concepts and methods of intrusion detection in OT systems, understand security telemetry, data sources, correlation rules, and the overall software architecture of a SIEM (Security Information and Event Management) in the ICS (Industrial Control Systems) domain.

You will work in collaboration with a developer to prototype and implement selected models using data stored in a NoSQL database (Elastic stack) as part of a custom interface. This task will be jointly performed in collaboration with other team members including data scientists, security experts, and software developers. The goal of the project is to design innovative methods that improve usability of a SIEM interface to SOC (Security Operations Center) engineers. Successful candidates will have the opportunity to work in close collaboration with an outstanding development team focusing on a unique market approach for threat detection in Industrial Control Systems.

The Challenge

  • Research, design, and implement data-driven machine learning/data mining algorithms based on high fidelity security data
  • Dive into massive, noisy, and complex real-world machine and user behavioral data to produce innovative analysis and new types of predictive models of engineering behaviors and manufacturing processes performance
  • Explore the potential of big data for design, engineering and analysis tasks and support the development of revolutionary approaches in the field of OT security intrusion detection
  • Present and discuss results (with potential of publication of results)

The Challenge

Qualified candidates will have/be:

  • A current student pursuing a BSc./MSc. degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Statistics / Mathematics / Computer Science / Computer Engineering, or other related subject with strong focus on machine learning and data mining. Please note, you must still be enrolled as a student during the internship period to qualify for the position.
  • Experience in the field of Big Data Analytics and machine learning with strong proficiency in data mining
  • Solid knowledge in statistics and exploratory data analysis
  • Strong proficiency in R and/or Python (including common analytics libraries, e.g., Pandas, SciKit-Learn, etc.) and good Java skills
  • Software development proficiency to work independently in Python
  • Capability for and interest in quick prototyping
  • Strong collaboration skills and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
  • Hands-on experience in command-line and development in Linux
  • Experience with the Elastic Stack (Elastic, Logstash, Kibana) desired
  • Experience with Jira and Gitlab, or similar platforms
  • Excellent knowledge of English (spoken and written)

Successful candidate must be able to work with controlled technology in accordance with US Export Control Law. US Export Control laws and applicable regulations govern the distribution of strategically important technology, services and information to foreign nationals and foreign countries. Siemens may require candidates under consideration for employment opportunities to submit information regarding citizenship status to allow the organization to comply with specific US Export Control laws and regulations. Additional information on the US Export Control laws & regulations can be found on https://www.bis.doc.gov/index.php/policy-guidance/deemed-exports/deemed-exports-faqs

Join Us

During this internship, you will experience the excitement and challenges of industrial research and be part of a world class team. An internship with Siemens Technology is a great opportunity for students to gain real world experience in a diverse work environment!

While we prefer the internship to be on site in our lab in Princeton, NJ, the uncertain future course of the pandemic makes it likely that this internship will need to happen entirely remotely. Hence, we offer this as a remote internship and thus encourage applicants from across the country.

Position Description:

Paid internship position at the United States Coast Guard Operations Systems Center located in Kearneysville, WV.

Schedule

Part-time: Typically 20-29 hours per week. Work days/hours can be flexible (within M-F normal business hours) to accommodate your academic schedule.
Duties & Responsibilities:
The United States Coast Guard (USCG) Command, Control, Communication, Computers, Cyber and Intelligence Service Center (C5ISC) Kearneysville Core Technology Services (CTS II) Contract has an opening for a Security Intern to join the Service Management Team. The Service Management Team supports IT infrastructure engineering and operations efforts across CTS, including:

  • Holistic management of IT infrastructure capacity that includes processes and technology
  • Report and dashboard creation and support for Key performance indicators (KPI) and metrics

About our group:

Seagate has one simple mission: to help the world save more of its precious data. Multiple studies have shown that machine learning, artificial intelligence, and data analytics are all improved with larger data sets. These methods are what is needed for the world to solve its important challenges from developing vaccines to combating climate change to improving autonomy in driving that saves lives. Unfortunately, however, the IDC projects that 158 of the 175 predicted zettabytes of data produced in 2025 will not be saved. By lowering the cost of storage, Seagate aims to rescue as much of this at-risk 158 zettabytes as possible to provide larger data sets and correspondingly improved learning, autonomy, and analytics. To achieve this goal, Seagate is harnessing the power of open source software to reduce data center costs. Our group is dedicated to this goal.

About the role - you will:

As a Developer Advocate intern, your role will be central to this important corporate strategy as you will help create the public face of Seagate’s open source initiatives. You will interact with a community who shares this vision to deliver the world’s best overall data center storage solutions optimized for both capacity and performance. In this role, you will evangelize Seagate’s vision and open source initiatives via blog posts, hackathons, meet-ups, and code integrations with popular third-party software suites such as pytorch, Map-Reduce, Kubernetes, and Spark for example. You will work to support and learn from our full-time developer advocates and gain valuable experience as well as an understanding of whether this unique type of role is suitable for a full-time career.

No community can be successful without an inclusive culture and you will be responsible for modeling and ensuring inclusive and respectful community behaviors to promote healthy growth and nurturing of the community. Additionally, you will represent the external community in internal forums to amplify their voices and smoothly deliver their contributions and ideas appropriately within Seagate.

Interns typically work Monday thru Friday 8am to 5pm. The hours are subject to change with or without notice at the sole discretion of Seagate.


About you:

  • PhD Degree (in progress) in Computer Science, Data Science or related fields
  • Currently enrolled student returning to school in fall 2021
  • Knowledge of third-party software suites such as Kubernetes, pytorch, Map-Reduce or Spark
  • Love to learn
  • Love to teach
  • Love technology
  • Love open source

position: Research Intern: Testing AI with Adversarial Analytics
description:
We are looking for a summer intern to investigate and develop approaches for automated adversarial testing of AI (Artificial Intelligence) / ML (Machine Learning) algorithms!

Data analytics methods are added via a variety of AI or ML methods into products, turning them into “smart” products. However, traditional approaches for security testing / penetration testing focus on the underlying system and hosting application, not on the AI algorithms themselves. However, recent research has shown that AI algorithms may be susceptible to malicious attacks that aim at tricking these AI algorithms into misclassifying input. This may have severe consequences, based on the area where such smart products are used. The goal of our research project is to create an overview about current state of research and state of the art, and devise approaches to test data analytics methods for susceptibility to attacks.

The internship will focus on providing an overview about existing technology and research results and put it into perspective in regard to usability for automated testing in industrial settings. Ideally, the intern will support the development of approaches to enhance research results, make results usable, and create a PoC for a (semi-)automated testing approach. You will learn about Adversarial Analytics and the current state of the art including promises and limitations. You will have the opportunity to put this knowledge into the perspective of a large industrial company with established goals and processes for proper security testing. Additionally, you will present and discuss results with experts from different cybersecurity disciplines and understand the specific challenges of transferring academic results to commercialization.

The Challenge

  • Understand state of the art and state of research in the area of Adversarial Analytics, specifically testing AI/ML algorithms for susceptibility for forced / intentional misclassification of inputs
  • Review available academic literature to create an overview about existing approaches and results, as well as directions in academic research
  • Select a subset of existing approaches and devise a strategy to create a Proof of Concept to allow further assessment of feasibility for automation and commercialization
  • Present and discuss results (with potential of publication of results)

The Candidate

  • A current student pursuing a MS/PhD degree in Computer Science / Data Science / Cybersecurity / Computer Engineering, or other related subject with a strong focus on IT-Security, Cybersecurity, or Data Science. PhD candidates or interns looking for a PhD topic preferred. Please note, you must still be enrolled as a student during the internship period to qualify for the position.
  • Experience with Adversarial Analytics preferred
  • Solid knowledge about and experience with Data Analytics methods, especially Machine Learning, required. Experience with improving classification results / reducing misclassifications preferred.
  • Ability for scientific work (reviewing papers and creating overviews about existing research / prior art) a significant plus
  • Experience in Penetration Testing / Security Assessments a significant plus
  • Solid software development skills (i.e., Python, Java or C/C++) a plus
  • Ability to give presentations about sophisticated technical topics
  • Excellent knowledge of English (spoken and written)

Successful candidate must be able to work with controlled technology in accordance with US Export Control Law. US Export Control laws and applicable regulations govern the distribution of strategically important technology, services and information to foreign nationals and foreign countries. Siemens may require candidates under consideration for employment opportunities to submit information regarding citizenship status to allow the organization to comply with specific US Export Control laws and regulations. Additional information on the US Export Control laws & regulations can be found on https://www.bis.doc.gov/index.php/policy-guidance/deemed-exports/deemed-exports-faqs

Join Us

During this internship, you will experience the excitement and challenges of industrial research and be part of a world class team. An internship with Siemens Technology is a great opportunity for students to gain real world experience in a diverse work environment!

While we prefer the internship to be on site in our lab in Princeton, NJ, the uncertain future course of the pandemic makes it likely that this internship will need to happen entirely remotely. Hence, we offer this as a remote internship and thus encourage applicants from across the country.

position: Software Development Intern: Security Data Visualization for Cyber Defense
description:
We are looking for a summer intern to prototype and develop innovative approaches for visualizing NoSQL data in the context of a cyber defense project for industrial control systems.

This task includes researching optimal methods for visualizing security data stored in Elastic format in collaboration with data scientists and developing JavaScript REACTJS-based web interfaces that implement such methods. You will learn about general concepts and methods of intrusion detection in OT systems (Operational Technology), understand security telemetry, data sources, correlation rules, and the overall software architecture of a SIEM (Security Information and Event Management) in the ICS (Industrial Control Systems) domain.

The internship will focus on developing/extending the interface of an existing software based on the Elastic stack (ELK=Elastic, Logstash, Kibana) to prototype, implement, and test an innovative OT detection feature. This task will be jointly performed in collaboration with data scientists and other developers and architects. The goal of the project is to design innovative methods that improve usability of a SIEM interface for SOC (Security Operations Center) engineers. Successful candidates will have the opportunity to work in close collaboration with an outstanding development team focusing on a unique market approach for threat detection in Industrial Control Systems.

The Challenge

  • Deploy and configure the Elastic Stack in a development environment using Linux / Windows
  • Identify and document security data visualization requirements in collaboration with the project Requirements Manager and data scientists
  • Model, design, and build a front end and backend application that implements identified requirements according to development best practices using REACTJS, Node.JS, Kibana, and Elastic UI Framework
  • Implement automated test cases for the backend application
  • Perform verification and validation tests
  • Document, present and discuss results

The Candidate
Qualified candidates will have/be:

  • A current student pursuing a BSc./MSc. degree in Computer Science / Computer Engineering, or other related subject. Please note, you must still be enrolled as a student during the internship period to qualify for the position.
  • Hands-on experience in command-line and development in Linux
  • Experience with the Elastic Stack (Elastic, Logstash, Kibana)
  • Experience with Jira and Gitlab, or similar platforms
  • Software development proficiency to work independently in Python
  • Software development proficiency to work independently on web front end JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Node.JS, ReactJS
  • Excellent knowledge of English (spoken and written)

Successful candidate must be able to work with controlled technology in accordance with US Export Control Law. US Export Control laws and applicable regulations govern the distribution of strategically important technology, services and information to foreign nationals and foreign countries. Siemens may require candidates under consideration for employment opportunities to submit information regarding citizenship status to allow the organization to comply with specific US Export Control laws and regulations. Additional information on the US Export Control laws & regulations can be found on https://www.bis.doc.gov/index.php/policy-guidance/deemed-exports/deemed-exports-faqs

Join Us

During this internship, you will experience the excitement and challenges of industrial research and be part of a world class team. An internship with Siemens Technology is a great opportunity for students to gain real world experience in a diverse work environment!

While we prefer the internship to be on site in our lab in Princeton, NJ, the uncertain future course of the pandemic makes it likely that this internship will need to happen entirely remotely. Hence, we offer this as a remote internship and thus encourage applicants from across the country.

We are looking for a summer intern to investigate and develop automated solutions for gathering and processing data from Ransomware leak websites. This task includes automating manual processes in Threat intelligence to help monitor ransomware leak websites.

Ransomware switched from encrypting data on victim machine to stealing the data and threatening to publish it on the internet should a ransom not be paid. Most malware families host a portal on the dark web where they announce the latest victim and often publish sample of stolen data.

It is important for a corporation like Siemens to know as soon as possible when confidential data exchanged with a partner, a customer, or a supplier may have been lost due to a ransomware attack. For this reason, Siemens is constantly monitoring Ransomware Leak websites for known victims and initiating respective internal investigations / security incidents.

Despite the potential for automation, this process is periodically carried out by an analyst in a purely manual fashion. The challenge for the candidate is to fully automate this process and integrate it with the ecosystem of the Siemens CERT (Computer Emergency Response Team).

The internship will focus mostly on development, i.e., creating tools that can automatically crawl ransomware leak website, parse content, identify victim organizations and alert on potential matches from a given list. As an intern, you will learn about current capabilities and strategies of ransomware and how corporations react to and protect against such threats in a hands-on manner, working closely with Siemens CERT’s Cyber Threat Intelligence experts.

The Challenge

  • Create an automated script to periodically access Ransomware leak portals in a secure way (VPN + Tor).
  • Create a backend processing platform that can take screenshots, parse web content, and extract names of the victim organizations.
  • Organize and store collected data for historical searches.
  • Compare the list of victims with a database of known companies of interest and create alerts in case of matches.
  • Automatically initiate download of relevant content for further processing.
  • Report on your results to management and technical staff

The Candidate
Qualified candidates will have/be:

  • A current student pursuing a BS/MS/PhD degree in Computer Science / Computer Engineering, or other related subject with a strong focus on IT-Security or Cybersecurity. Please note, you must still be enrolled as a student during the internship period to qualify for the position.
  • Experience developing software in Python is required. Experience with Django is a plus.
  • Experience with Git is required. Experience with Gitlab, or similar platforms is a plus
  • Experience with Linux and command lines in required
  • Experience in implementing web APIs is a plus
  • Experience with Tor is a plus
  • Experience in identity access management is a plus
  • Prior experience with natural language processing and/or code profiling a significant plus
  • Ability to give presentations about sophisticated technical topics
  • Excellent knowledge of English (spoken and written)

Successful candidate must be able to work with controlled technology in accordance with US Export Control Law. US Export Control laws and applicable regulations govern the distribution of strategically important technology, services and information to foreign nationals and foreign countries. Siemens may require candidates under consideration for employment opportunities to submit information regarding citizenship status to allow the organization to comply with specific US Export Control laws and regulations. Overview:

Prepare your career for Takeoff at MTSI!!

MTIS is looking for an Engineering Intern in our Huntsville, AL location. Modern Technology Solutions, Inc. (MTSI) is 100% employee-owned. position: Software Engineer Intern - Reverse Engineering (Research) Fall 2021
description:
Overview:
GrammaTech’s internship program offers students the opportunity to gain real experience in a friendly, open, and supportive environment. This position is on the Research side of our business, projects chosen are based on real needs, and interns work closely with engineers to make sure that projects are completed successfully.

GrammaTech will conduct a series of programming tests and screening interviews as part of our process in C, Python, and possibly other languages. There are multiple positions available on varying teams and a position will remain posted until all roles are filled.
Responsibilities:
Research projects at GrammaTech can take on a wide variety of topics and challenges. Projects focus on software assurance, software protection, reverse engineering, and software producibility. We do both static and dynamic analysis on both source and object code, in order to tackle serious problems with practical solutions.

Some past and future examples of intern projects:
  • Compile benchmark programs, design and run a large-scale Bug-Injector experiment
  • Web development of a reverse-engineering diagram viewer and editor
  • Improve precision and recall of similar machine code search, including feature engineering, run experiments to identify gaps, and implement solutions
  • Expand testing for vulnerability detection and rewriting for embedded systems. Set up sample systems, identify vulnerabilities, and test if our tools offer strong protection.
  • Builds tools to infer security policies for drone components and fuzz those components to find inputs that violate the policies.
Qualifications:
Required
  • Currently enrolled in a BS, MS, or PhD in Computer Science
  • Excellent programming skills (C, Python) in Linux or Windows environments
  • Experience with reverse engineering, assembly programming, and/or fuzz testing


Preferred
  • Enrollment in a Computer Science PhD program
About the Company


Innovation is at the heart of GrammaTech, and we are constantly pushing the boundaries of software research and development–from software assurance and software integrity to cyber‐security, threat mitigation and autonomic computing. We develop new technologies and see the results of our research incorporated into tools used by engineers and security professionals worldwide.

GrammaTech was founded in 1988, with the firmly grounded purpose of helping today’s organizations develop tomorrow’s software. With a focus on the evolving cyber‐security landscape, software hardening, and intelligent systems, we tackle the most challenging software issues through a constant stream of highly innovative research and commercial development programs. Headquartered in Bethesda, MD, and a Research and Development Center in Ithaca, NY, as well as opportunities for remote employment.

GrammaTech, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity/Disability/Veterans/Affirmative Action employer.
Members of underrepresented groups are encouraged to apply.

Ankura is a team of excellence founded on innovation and growth.

This position supports the Ankura Disputes & Economics Business Group - one of seven practices focused on client delivery services across the Firm.

Practice Summary: The Disputes and Economics practice focuses on assisting clients with financial, accounting, and economic issues associated with complex litigation. A sample of diverse consulting engagements includes: consulting and preparation of expert reports and testimony in consumer class action, overdraft fee/banking, labor and employment, and healthcare matters; consulting on complex forensic accounting and financial reporting matters; and litigation support.

Position Summary: Our Summer Internship Program has been created to give students an opportunity to learn what life as a consultant in our Disputes & Economics practice is like at Ankura. As an Intern, you will work on a variety of projects with different engagement teams. The program aims to give you exposure to the breadth of our services and client work. You will work closely with our professionals – Consultants through Senior Director – and gain first-hand experience in consulting. Your assignments may involve work in fact-finding, allocating costs, analyzing damages, organizing information, or helping to manage data. You will also learn new skills and participate in social and volunteer activities throughout the summer.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Interns perform a wide range of functions that may include developing and performing financial, accounting, economic, and statistical analyses; loading and validating data received from clients into structured data formats; developing models using data analytical tools and programs; performing detailed and complex spreadsheet analyses; assisting with data gathering activities including document review, research, and quality control of data entry activities; and preparation of client reports and exhibits.

Basic Qualifications, Skills, and Characteristics:

  • Third year undergraduate students graduating between December 2021 and June 2022 with a preference for candidates majoring in Finance, Economics, Accounting, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or other analytical course of study.
  • Solid academic performance with a 3.3 cumulative GPA or better.
  • A working knowledge of MS Office Suite (e.g., Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and strong research and analytical skills.
  • Strong oral and written communication skills.
  • Initiative, adaptability, creative problem-solving skills, an ability to work well with teams, self-motivated, and able to work overtime when needed.
  • Advanced technical skills with statistical and/or database programming software (e.g., SQL, R, Python, Stata, SAS) is a plus.

Our 2021 Summer Internship Program is scheduled to run from May/June 2021 until August/September 2021. This 12-week program is designed to provide students the opportunity to get a better understanding of a unique fintech platform (Hint MD) within the biotech pharma industry. This is a paid internship as a temporary employee, working up to 40 hours per week in our Pleasanton location.

Dare to make a difference? Be ready to be feel valued, developed, engaged, and empowered. The Data Analytics team at Revance Therapeutics is looking for an audacious Data Analyst Pioneer (Intern). Yes, Pioneer! You will work alongside specialists within our group to help develop the future of our function.

What do we do? We are building an Integrated fintech platform designed to transform existing payment processing ecosystems and improve both aesthetic practice economics and patient experiences.

There is nothing like your own experience. An internship within the Data Analytics team at Revance Therapeutics not only offers an opportunity to build your skills and confidence, but also to work on projects that give you insight into who we are and what we do as a Biotech and Fintech Company (who’s growing at a rapid speed) as well as for the wider community. This is a unique opportunity to intern with an integrated digital services platform targeted to aesthetic practice payment services.

You will be assigned tasks to develop your understanding of what we really do, and you will build networks with your colleagues in Data Analytics and Software Engineering. Not only will you work on tasks that address the present needs but will help with tasks that drive value for the future of the team. Opportunity is at the heart of a career at Revance Therapeutics and our Data Analytics internship offers just that.


Essential Duties/Responsibilities
  • Work closely with Product team, QA Engineers, SME’s to determine appropriate data sources and to define data provisioning mechanism from building data pipelines to dashboards
  • Conceptualizing, developing, and maintaining dashboards and visualizations
  • Examine through large amounts of data, extract key insights, and communicate concisely
  • Identify key metrics and build executive facing dashboards to track progress of the business
  • Identify data automation opportunities and manage projects to refine the process by getting hands-on with the data stack
  • Improve the quality of existing data pipeline, data warehouse, setting up alerts on anomaly detections, well-thought out ETL, and clearly documenting the workflows
  • Learn and contribute to the design of data management and any future transformation of the data engineering landscape
  • Demonstrate flexibility as needed. Participate in manual testing, automated testing, put out fires (not literally) and troubleshooting when required.
  • Prepare presentations, reports, and analytics
  • Collaborate with intern peers to propose solutions to real business problems
  • Execute a group project with fellow interns
  • Participate in the mentoring sessions, guest speaker series, and training modules
  • Participate in a community service program
  • Assist with the engagement survey action plan project
  • Other duties as assigned

Education

  • Current 3rd or 4th year students pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics or related field

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

  • Familiarity with ETL tools. Knowledge in Redshift and PostgreSQL is preferred.

The Process Engineer Intern will work with subject matter experts and be responsible for developing core technical proficiencies on the equipment, processes, and procedures for application of Aprecia’s proprietary three-dimensional printing (3DP) technology for Technical Transfer and scale up of Aprecia’s products to commercial manufacturing at Blue Ash, OH facility.

Duties/Responsibilities

3 Learn and provide support for risk analysis performed in Technical Services and assure appropriate parameters are evaluated. Training on appropriate statistical approaches associated with testing for justification and support of critical process parameters and quality attributes

Position Purpose

The purpose of an internship at Woodward is to provide students with the opportunity to gain exposure and “real life” business acumen within industry. Our internships also provide students with the opportunity to learn and gain practical experience and to work in areas related to their academic and/or career interests. Gain hands-on experience while working on challenging projects, network with professionals and learn from some of the brightest minds in business.
The experience also gives the intern opportunity for potential full-time employment with the company and an understanding of JavaScript and the PTC ThingWorx platform.
This intern will contribute to IT projects that will add features to our operations-critical Manufacturing Information System. This system is directly related to operational excellence and involves elements of Industrial Internet of Things (IIOT). The ideal candidate will have the ability to learn about our operations processes and apply cutting edge technology to automate and improve those processes driving to improve quality and increase efficiency of our production operations.



Essential Functions


  • Complete tasks on computer using MS Office programs such as Word, Excel and Power Point.

Woodward is an independent designer, manufacturer, and service provider of control solutions for the aerospace and energy markets. Drive global technology


With more than $2 billion in revenues, CDK Global is a leading global provider of integrated information technology and digital marketing solutions to the automotive retail and adjacent industries. Focused on enabling end-to-end automotive commerce, CDK provides solutions to dealers in more than 100 countries around the world, serving approximately 28,000 retail locations and most automotive manufacturers. CDK Global solutions automate and integrate critical processes from pre-sale targeted advertising to the sale, financing, insurance, parts supply, repair and maintenance of vehicles, with an increasing focus on utilizing data analytics and predictive intelligence.


We’re large enough to make a difference but small enough for your voice to be heard. This means that we are an organization where every person matters. You can make an impact on the success of our business and that of our customers regardless of what career you decide to pursue.


From data scientists to sales and client service experts, we’re hiring to support your growth and ours - Green light your career.

CDK Global Stability meets Agility. CDK is the largest technology provider to the automotive industry, with more than 26,000 dealer sites in over 100 countries and nearly 9,000 employees worldwide. We’re hiring to support your growth and ours.

CDK Global works with a broad variety of technologies, so your Java, .Net, C#, C++, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3 or other technology interests and skills may work well with us. We build software that is used by consumers to shop for cars, as well as the systems used by about two-thirds of the dealers in the US to take care of their customers and their interface with the manufacturers. The CDK Global Engineering team is a group of fun, pragmatic, full-stack engineers with multi-language coding skills focused on engineering excellence and continuous improvement.


The most important thing to us about you is that you have a passion for working on cool stuff. And can work well with cool people. We love the energy shown in your projects (and those side projects you do, ‘just for you’). And we love that you can get in a room with amazing developers and learn and teach and contribute and grow. Our agile, collaborative approach is important to everyone here.


As a Software Development Intern you will help to engineer the next generation of enterprise class software solutions at CDK utilizing a broad range of the latest technologies. The intern's primary responsibilities include development of application, services and components. The internship will provide hands-on technical experience and will work with other team members, architects and product owners in the early and continuous delivery of high quality software products that delight our customers. Students must be a result oriented individual, who can use agile software development principles to delight our customers.

Student Intern - Crowson Research

- (3151516)


Remote Undergraduate Clinical Data Science Research Opportunity, Dr. Crowson’s Lab, Mass Eye & Ear

Contact information:
Matthew G. Crowson MD MPA MASc FRCSC

Laboratory Website: https://projects.iq.harvard.edu/crow/people/matthew-g-crowson

Harvard Catalyst Profile: https://connects.catalyst.harvard.edu/Profiles/display/Person/193106

Project description and duties:

Dr. Crowson’s work involves applying data science techniques (i.e. machine learning and its various forms) to clinical data. Dr. Crowson has several ongoing projects including innovative applications of:

  • Computer vision for image segmentation as part of autonomous surgery,
  • Natural Language Processing for clinical notes,
  • Among others.

Dr. Crowson also performs ‘traditional’ clinical research using existing clinical data from the electronic health record. Further, Dr. Crowson also generates systematic reviews and other review-style manuscripts of interest to the machine learning and Otolaryngology fields.

Example prior projects:

Crowson MG, Dixon P, Mahmood R, Lee JW, Shipp D, Le T, Lin V, Chen J, Chan TCY. Predicting Postoperative Cochlear Implant Performance Using Supervised Machine Learning. Otol Neurotol. 2020 Sep; 41(8):e1013-e1023. PMID: 32558750.

Crowson MG, Lee JW, Hamour A, Mahmood R, Babier A, Lin V, Tucci DL, Chan TCY. AutoAudio: Deep Learning for Automatic Audiogram Interpretation. J Med Syst. 2020 Aug 07; 44(9):163. PMID: 32770269.

Crowson MG, Hamour A, Lin V, Chen JM, Chan TCY. Machine learning for pattern detection in cochlear implant FDA adverse event reports. Cochlear Implants Int. 2020 11; 21(6):313-322. PMID: 32623971.
Learning outcomes:

Goals for this research experience is to improve competency in data analysis methods, presentations, and scientific writing. Deliverables such as 1-2 peer reviewed manuscripts with student serving as first-author on the manuscript if work completed. The student may complete additional manuscripts if motivated.

Relevant texts for methods of the lab:

  • Applied Predictive Modeling. by Max Kuhn and Kjell Johnson. ISBN-10: 1461468485
  • R for Data Science: Import, Tidy, Transform, Visualize, and Model Data by Hadley Wickham and Garrett Grolemund. ISBN-10: 1491910399

Dr. Crowson, the principal investigator, will be the primary mentor. Research meetings will be held weekly, as well as continued daily contact using a mobile/web-based platform (e.g. Discord or Slack).

About Us:

Massachusetts Eye and Ear is an international center for treatment and home to the world's largest vision and hearing research centers. Mass. Eye and Ear is a member of Mass General Brigham and a teaching hospital of Harvard Medical School.

Mass. Eye and Ear clinicians are driven by a mission to find cures for blindness, deafness and diseases of the head and neck. Internationally acclaimed since its founding in 1824, Mass. Eye and Ear employs full-time, board-certified physicians who offer high quality and affordable specialty care that ranges from the routine to the very complex. Learn more about our Mission, Vision and Values and Diversity, Equity and Inclusion on our site.

Providing a safe environment for everyone is the core tenet of our Safe Care Commitment. Across Mass General Brigham, employees are doing their part to ensure that the hospitals, clinics, practices and office spaces across our system are safe and ready.



Mass. Eye and Ear physicians are located at our main campus in Boston, and at our suburban locations in the greater Boston and Providence areas, across 21 locations.


Skills required:

Some experience with statistics and computer programming languages such as Python or R strongly recommended. Students do not necessarily need to consider medicine as a possible career, as computer science and engineering students would also benefit from such an experience. Experience with machine learning techniques preferred.

Personalis is a rapidly growing cancer genomics company transforming the development of next-generation therapies by providing more comprehensive molecular data about each patient's cancer and immune response. Our ImmunoID NeXT Platform® is enabling the development of next generation immuno-oncology therapeutics and diagnostics.

Summary:

You will join a team of software engineers whose mission is to simplify, modernize and scale business. The business needs robust, high-performance software that can accurately and reliably orchestrate analysis of large volumes of next-generation sequencing (NGS) data. Our in-house developed software platform called "Symphony" provides the infrastructure to scale our business for a wide range of clinical and research applications, from genetic disease research, to cancer clinical diagnostics, to leading-edge developments in immuno-oncology.

We are offering a summer internship opportunity to promising computer science students who have a professional interest in software engineering. This internship will offer you direct exposure to real world industry applications of software engineering to the rapidly growing biotechnology space and will focus on developing you in areas where a computer science curriculum typically does not.

The internship will be approximately 10-12 weeks in duration (dates flexible depending on your academic calendar).

Responsibilities:

The emphasis of this internship program is to gain exposure to best industry practices in software engineering. You will be responsible for a summer project from conception through feasibility, development, testing and rolling into "production".

During the 10-12-week program, you will:

  • Understand the latest technology in software engineering, its impact on immuno-oncology, bioinformatics, Next Generation Sequencing and high-performance computing and where you can best focus your academic studies for future career direction.
  • Select your summer project with direct business application(s).
  • Create a project plan for your summer project with a well defined scope and realistic deadlines.
  • Leverage Agile development practices as more information about your summer project becomes available during the development process.
  • Participate in our weekly Kanban planning and semi-weekly standups.
  • Leverage technologies such as Java, Springboot, Hibernate, ReactJS, Kubernetes, Docker, Linux, Bash and Python to effectively build and operate software that help run the business.
  • Version control software source code and file system resources and gain exposure to common versioning/branching strategies.
  • Learn coding standards/conventions and undergo at least one code review of your project with the software engineering group.
  • Write regression and unit tests to ensure desired functionality over time.
  • Understand and leverage CI-CD pipeline to automated deployments & automated testing, signifying your work is ready for "production".
  • Presentation of your summer project to the Personalis Research & Development organization.

A successful intern will emerge with valuable, hands-on industry experience and find him/herself in a fantastic position for a career in the software industry.

Requirements:

  • Support engineering efforts to explore new methods and technologies in the cutting-edge software engineering group at a rapidly growing company
  • See your summer project from feasibility through "production" with a final presentation to conclude
  • Software interns will be required to work on Pacific Standard Time.
  • The ideal candidate will be completing their junior year of undergrad, or first year of graduate school at a top university and will be returning to school in the fall.
  • Software development
    • Experience with language such as Java and ReactJS.
    • Familiarity with Unix/Linux or OS X command line
    • Familiarity with testing frameworks like JUnit, Jest,
  • Due to COVID-19 pandemic, this position will be 100% remote but only available to candidates residing in and authorized to work in the United States.

Education:

Our group has engineers (senior and entry level) working closely with their respective expertise to solve complex distributed problems.

ML & AI models will be applied on the data once its reaches our Data Lake.

    • Data Platform is an effort to make SAP SuccessFactors an Data Driven Company to serve or internal & external customers

Company description

Started in 1933, Green Bay Packaging Inc. (GBP) is a privately family-owned , vertically integrated and diversified manufacturing company consisting of corrugated container converting plants, folding carton operations, recycled and virgin linerboard mills, pressure-sensitive label rollstock, specialty converting operations, timberlands, and a sawmill facility. Job description
This position is a paid internship for a college student currently working towards a degree in Computer Science, Information Management, or another related field. Candidate will work with data that helps facilitate decisions throughout the company. The position will work on projects that meet both educational goals and data analytics goals of the company. Projects will include interpreting data, designing/developing, basic programming, maintaining, and improving Business Intelligence (BI) solutions. In addition, this individual works closely with various business departments to define reporting and data needs.

Responsibilities Include

  • Designs and creates new reports, dashboards, and data analyses.
  • Implements revisions to existing reports, dashboards, and data analyses.
  • Assures proper validation of new or revised reports is completed.
  • Optimizes efficient acquisition of data to support quality surveillance and quality improvement.
  • Builds reports to pull data from both transactional and analytical data housed within a variety of systems.
  • Participates in development, data collection and analysis to support improvement projects.
  • Translates complex requests from organizational staff without technical background into language that allows accurate report building.
  • Validates reports against other data sources to assure accuracy.
  • Supports maximal efficiency of Analytics Team by recommending and providing more efficient data gathering options.
  • Prepares materials to best present collected data (graphics, charts, trend lines, etc.).
  • Responds to ad hoc report requests.
  • Maintains daily, weekly, monthly report processes.
  • Streamlines existing reporting and analyses processes where possible.
  • Trains new users on use of the reporting products.
  • Encourages and assists users in the use of additional/new product features.
  • Designs, develops, implements, and manages data using best practices for analytics.
  • Designs, develops, owns, and maintains ETL/ELT data flows across a constellation of data sources and systems.
  • Identifies areas of improvement.
  • Performs administration and maintenance of reporting environment.
  • Completes software maintenance and upgrade tasks.
  • Assists in the development of backup and disaster recovery procedures.
  • Communicates with vendors for support and resolution of issues as needed.
  • Remains knowledgeable of industry trends, practices, and innovations.
  • Respects and maintains confidentiality.
  • Works in a safe, compliant, and ethical manner.
  • Identify and escalate situations requiring urgent attention.
  • Work closely with others to complete a task.
  • Redirect problems to appropriate resource.
  • Learn to become a liaison between IT professionals and end user.

position: Research Internship - Fall 2021 (NLP, Computer Vision, or Machine Learning)
description:
Type: Internship
Experience: PhD/Graduate Students

Who we are:

Dataminr puts real-time AI and public data to work for our clients, generating relevant and actionable alerts for global corporations, public sector agencies, newsrooms, and NGOs. Our leading AI platform detects the earliest signals of high-impact events and emerging risks from vast amounts of publicly available information. Our real-time alerts enable tens of thousands of users at hundreds of public and private sector organizations to learn first of breaking events around the world, develop effective risk mitigation strategies, and respond with confidence as crises unfold.

Dataminr is making its mark for growth and innovation, recently earning recognition on the Deloitte Technology Fast 500, Forbes AI 50 and Forbes Cloud 100 lists. We also earned accolades for 'Most Innovative Use of AI' from the 2020 AI & Machine Learning Awards.

Join our team and help the world manage risk in real time. You'll work with 600+ talented people across seven offices, united by our passion to collaborate, make a difference, and have fun while doing it!

Who you are:

You're a Ph.D. candidate who has published in top tier conferences and are passionate about having a positive impact on the world. You are enthusiastic about working on some of the most challenging problems in AI, working in a highly collaborative environment and directly contributing to products while advancing the state of the art. You are very creative, can work independently, and are an excellent collaborator and communicator.

Responsibilities:

  • Perform research to advance the state of the art and solve specific problems at scale in one or more of the following areas: NLP, HCI, Machine Learning/Deep Learning, Computer Vision, Complex Networks.
  • Work closely with a diverse, interdisciplinary team on a specific project to be completed during the internship.
  • Excel in placing a human-centered focus on the work (context, end-user impact, etc), finding solutions that work in practice and have significant impact.

Minimum qualifications:


  • Must be enrolled in a Ph.D. program in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or a related field.
  • Ideal candidates will have had prior internship experience.
  • Outstanding publication record in the candidate's field of study (ACL, CVPR, CHI, WWW, RecSys, ICCV, NIPS, ICML, etc.).
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently, set up experiments and demonstrate progress through principled used of metrics.

Dataminr is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Individuals seeking employment at Dataminr are considered without regards to race, sex, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, genetics, marital status, pregnancy, unemployment status, sexual orientation, citizenship status or veteran status.
